original: chos btsal ba'i skabs kyi rjes la /
analyzed: chos btsal ba'i skabs kyi rjes la /
translated: After the section on the search for the Dharma,

original: chos bstan pa'i skabs bshad bar 'brel to //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i skabs bshad bar 'brel to //
translated: the section on the teaching of the Dharma is relevant.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' chos btsal ba bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la gsal bar bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' chos btsal ba bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la gsal bar bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Or else, the bodhisattva searches for the Dharma not only in order to illuminate his own mental continuum,

original: sems can gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang tshol te ;
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang tshol te ;

original: chos gsal ba ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyud gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: chos gsal ba ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyud gsal bar byas so //

original: chos bshad pas ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: chos bshad pas ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud gsal bar byed de /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma illuminates the mental continuums of others.

original: de bas na chos bcal ba'i rjes la chos bstan pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na chos bcal ba'i rjes la chos bstan pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, after the section on the search for the Dharma, the section on the teaching of the Dharma is relevant.

original: chos bstan pa la ser sna spangs ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos bstan pa la ser sna spangs ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the elimination of stinginess in teaching the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos ston pa na ser sna 'byung ba'i skabs cung zad kyang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos ston pa na ser sna 'byung ba'i skabs cung zad kyang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The verse is composed in order to show that when the bodhisattva teaches the Dharma, there is not even the slightest stinginess.

original: lus dang longs spyod dka' bas rnyed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod dka' bas rnyed // ces bya ba la /
translated: The body and wealth are obtained with difficulty.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni lus so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni lus so //
translated: The five aggregates of form, etc. are the body.

original: 'bru dang gter la sogs pa ni longs spyod do //
analyzed: 'bru dang gter la sogs pa ni longs spyod do //
translated: Grain, treasure, etc. are wealth.

original: lus kyang sdug bsngal bas rnyed pas na dka' bas rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyang sdug bsngal bas rnyed pas na dka' bas rnyed pa zhes bya'o //

original: ji ltar na lus sdug bsngal bas rnyed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus sdug bsngal bas rnyed ce na /
translated: How is the body obtained with suffering?

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrub par dka' ba brgya stong du mas byas pas lus rnyed de /üîΩde bas na mdo las kyang rgya mtsho'i nang na gnas pa'i rus sbal zhar ba lo brgya zhing lan cig khar byung bas gnya' shing mig gcig pa phyogs bzhi'i rlung gis phyogs bcur bdas pa'i mig tu mgo chud par sla'i mi'i lus thob pa ni shin tu dka'o
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrub par dka' ba brgya stong du mas byas pas lus rnyed de / de bas na mdo las kyang rgya mtsho'i nang na gnas pa'i rus sbal zhar ba lo brgya zhing lan cig khar byung bas gnya' shing mig gcig pa phyogs bzhi'i rlung gis phyogs bcur bdas pa'i mig tu mgo chud par sla'i mi'i lus thob pa ni shin tu dka'o
translated: The body is obtained through the performance of roots of virtue that are difficult to perform, through hundreds of thousands of lives.üîΩTherefore, a sutra declares:

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is easier for a blind turtle that lives in the ocean, which emerges once every hundred years to the surface, to put its neck through a yoke with a single hole that is being carried by the wind in the four directions and blown in the four main directions, than it is for a human rebirth to be obtained.üîΩ‚Äù

original: longs spyod ji ltar rnyed par dka' zhe na /
analyzed: longs spyod ji ltar rnyed par dka' zhe na /
translated: How is wealth difficult to obtain?

original: rin po che la sogs pa'i nor gyi phyir rgya mtsho la sogs par 'jug pa na /
analyzed: rin po che la sogs pa'i nor gyi phyir rgya mtsho la sogs par 'jug pa na /
translated: When one enters the ocean, etc. for the sake of wealth such as jewels,

original: grang ba'i dus na ni grang bas nye na /
analyzed: grang ba'i dus na ni grang bas nye na /
translated: in cold weather one is afflicted by cold,

original: tsha ba'i dus na ni tsha bas nyen /
analyzed: tsha ba'i dus na ni tsha bas nyen /
translated: in hot weather one is afflicted by heat,

original: bar 'ga' ni bkres pas nyen /
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni bkres pas nyen /
translated: sometimes one is afflicted by hunger,üîΩsometimes one is afflicted by thirst, etc.

original: bar 'ga' ni skom pas nyen pa la sogs pa lus dang srog la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal gyis btsal dgos pas ni rnyed par dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni skom pas nyen pa la sogs pa lus dang srog la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal gyis btsal dgos pas ni rnyed par dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one must seek wealth with the suffering of harm to body and life, it is called difficult to obtain.

original: de ltar rnyed par dka' ba de'ang btang ma thag tu 'jig cing med par 'gyur bas na snying po med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnyed par dka' ba de'ang btang ma thag tu 'jig cing med par 'gyur bas na snying po med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since that which is difficult to obtain in that way is destroyed and becomes non-existent immediately after giving it up, it is called essenceless.

original: longs spyod btang ste zad na ni phongs pa dang brel ba la sogs pa dbul ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: longs spyod btang ste zad na ni phongs pa dang brel ba la sogs pa dbul ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur la /
translated: When enjoyments are given and exhausted, one experiences the suffering of poverty such as distress and urgency.

original: lus btang na ni 'chi bar 'gyur bas na snying po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus btang na ni 'chi bar 'gyur bas na snying po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the body is given up, one dies. Therefore, it is called essenceless.

original: de la 'jig rten pa rnams ni lus dang longs spyod gtong bar dka' bas na sems can gzhan la sbyin par bya bar mi rigs pa rnyed par dka' @223b bde'ang btang na zad par mi 'gyur ba ni btang ba'i yang rigs na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa rnams ni lus dang longs spyod gtong bar dka' bas na sems can gzhan la sbyin par bya bar mi rigs pa rnyed par dka' @223b bde'ang btang na zad par mi 'gyur ba ni btang ba'i yang rigs na /
translated: The worldly, because they find it difficult to give up their bodies and possessions, think it is not right to give them to other sentient beings.üîΩIf one gives what is difficult to obtain, it will not be exhausted.

original: btang na yang zad par yang 'gyur bas btang bar mi rigs so snyam du sems so //
analyzed: btang na yang zad par yang 'gyur bas btang bar mi rigs so snyam du sems so //

original: de pas bzlog ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni brtan pas dga' ba yid kyis su /üîΩrtag tu sdug bsngal sems can rnams la sbyin pa rnam mang rgya che sbyin byas nas //
analyzed: de pas bzlog ste byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni brtan pas dga' ba yid kyis su / rtag tu sdug bsngal sems can rnams la sbyin pa rnam mang rgya che sbyin byas nas //
translated: The bodhisattvas, on the other hand, are the opposite.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: With a joyful mind, they always give to suffering sentient beings, giving many kinds of gifts on a vast scale.

original: brtan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The steadfast are the bodhisattvas.

original: dga' ba'i yid ni lus dang longs spyod gtong ba ni mos ba dang rang dang bcas pa'i sems kyis gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i yid ni lus dang longs spyod gtong ba ni mos ba dang rang dang bcas pa'i sems kyis gtong ba'o //
translated: With a joyful mind means that they give their bodies and possessions with a mind that is full of joy.

original: rtag tu lan cig gtong bar ma zad kyi 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du dus thams cad du gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu lan cig gtong bar ma zad kyi 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du dus thams cad du gtong ba'o //
translated: Always means that they give not just once but at all times until the end of cyclic existence.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can ni brel ba dang / phongs pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can ni brel ba dang / phongs pa'i sems can rnams so //

original: sbyin pa rnam pa mang po ni nor dang 'bru la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa mang po ni nor dang 'bru la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po gtong ba'o //

original: rgya chen po sbyin pa ni mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa nang gi dngos bo gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po sbyin pa ni mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa nang gi dngos bo gtong ba'o //
translated: Giving extensively means giving internal things such as one's head, legs, and arms.

original: rnam pa kun gyis 'gro la phan byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyis 'gro la phan byed ces bya ba la /
translated: Benefiting beings in every way means

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi chos dang / chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni nyan pa'i tshe na yang sems can la phan par byed /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi chos dang / chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni nyan pa'i tshe na yang sems can la phan par byed /
translated: that when one listens to the ultimate and conventional teachings and to the specific and general characteristics of phenomena, one benefits sentient beings.

original: sems pa na yang phan par byed /
analyzed: sems pa na yang phan par byed /
translated: When one reflects on them, one benefits them.

original: bsgom pa na yang phan par byed pas na rnam pa kun gyis 'gro la phan byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa na yang phan par byed pas na rnam pa kun gyis 'gro la phan byed ces bya'o //
translated: When one cultivates them, one benefits them. Thus it says, benefiting beings in every way.

original: rgya chen zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la theg pa chen po'i chos so //
analyzed: rgya chen zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la theg pa chen po'i chos so //
translated: Extensive means the teachings of the Great Vehicle such as the stages and perfections.

original: rnyed dka' bas ma rnyed pa //
analyzed: rnyed dka' bas ma rnyed pa //
translated: It is difficult to obtain, so it is not obtained.

original: zhes bya bas ni yang dka' ba mang pos sgrub mi dgos te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni yang dka' ba mang pos sgrub mi dgos te /
translated: This shows that it is not necessary to practice with many hardships.

original: tshegs chung dus sgrub po zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrab tu sbyin yang mi 'bri 'phel 'gyur chos lta smos kyang ci dgos te //
analyzed: tshegs chung dus sgrub po zhes bya ba'i don to // rab tu sbyin yang mi 'bri 'phel 'gyur chos lta smos kyang ci dgos te //

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩlus dang longs spyod rnyed par dka' pa ni sbyin na zad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / lus dang longs spyod rnyed par dka' pa ni sbyin na zad par 'gyur gyi /

original: 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'phel bar ni mi 'gyur gyi /

original: dam pa'i chos gzhan la byin te bstan na 'bri bar ni mi 'gyur gyi 'phel ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gzhan la byin te bstan na 'bri bar ni mi 'gyur gyi 'phel ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: But when one gives the holy Dharma to others and teaches it, it does not diminish, but increases.üîΩFor example, when one lights many lamps from a single lamp, the first lamp is not diminished, and many other lamps increase.

original: dper na mar me gcig las mar me mang po bus na dang po'i mar me la 'bri ba med cing mar me gzhan mang po yang 'phel bar 'gyur ba bzhin du chos bshad na yang sems can gzhan gyis thos pa dag shes pa mang du 'byung bar 'gyur
analyzed: dper na mar me gcig las mar me mang po bus na dang po'i mar me la 'bri ba med cing mar me gzhan mang po yang 'phel bar 'gyur ba bzhin du chos bshad na yang sems can gzhan gyis thos pa dag shes pa mang du 'byung bar 'gyur
translated: When one explains the Dharma, the knowledge of other sentient beings who hear it increases.

original: la 'chad pa po'i shes pa la nyams pa med pas na mi 'bri ba'i 'phel bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la 'chad pa po'i shes pa la nyams pa med pas na mi 'bri ba'i 'phel bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no decrease in the knowledge of the expounder, it is called the increase that does not diminish.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus dang longs spyod rnyed par dka' la /üîΩbtang na yang med par 'gyur ba de rgyun ma chad par sems can @224a * //üîΩsdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje ba'i dbang gis dga' bzhin du sbyin par byed na dam pa'i chos btsal bar sla la btang yang 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus dang longs spyod rnyed par dka' la / btang na yang med par 'gyur ba de rgyun ma chad par sems can @224a * // sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje ba'i dbang gis dga' bzhin du sbyin par byed na dam pa'i chos btsal bar sla la btang yang 'phel bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, for bodhisattvas, body and wealth are difficult to acquire,üîΩbut, through the power of compassion for suffering beings, they are given away without interruption,üîΩand, if given, they increase, not decreasing.

original: 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba sems can la gtong ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba sems can la gtong ba lta ci smos te /
translated: How much more so when they are given to beings, since the holy Dharma is easy to acquire and, if given, increases, not decreasing.

original: gtong ches so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtong ches so zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rgal ba srog dang longs spyod bas //
analyzed: rgal ba srog dang longs spyod bas //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúFor the sake of the Dharma, life and wealth are given away.‚Äù

original: chos ces btsal dka' ste /
analyzed: chos ces btsal dka' ste /
translated: The Dharma is difficult to acquire.

original: 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam gyi phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' lus rnams yongs su gtong bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam gyi phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' lus rnams yongs su gtong bas so //
translated: For the sake of a single verse, bodhisattvas give away their bodies.

original: de bas na mdo dag las /
analyzed: de bas na mdo dag las /
translated: Therefore, in the s≈´tras,

original: legs smras tshigs bcad gcig tsam phyir //üîΩthub pa sku'i rin gyis btsal lo //
analyzed: legs smras tshigs bcad gcig tsam phyir // thub pa sku'i rin gyis btsal lo //
translated: For the sake of a single verse of well-spoken words,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: the Sage would have sought it even by selling his body.

original: sa bcu'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: sa bcu'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Dashabhumika Sutra says,

analyzed: tshig gcig gi don du me mdag gis yongs su gang ba'i dong du yang bdag nyid 'dor bar spro'o zhes bshad de /

analyzed: de ltar na shin tu sdug bsngal bas rnyed pa ji ltar na dka' ba med pas rnyed pa yin no zhes bya ba zhe na /

original: de'i don lan du don 'di ni de ltar gzung ba ma yin te sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba nas brtsams nas bstan pa ma nub kyi bar du chos ni tshegs chung dus rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don lan du don 'di ni de ltar gzung ba ma yin te sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba nas brtsams nas bstan pa ma nub kyi bar du chos ni tshegs chung dus rnyed pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of that is not to be taken literally. The Dharma is obtained with little difficulty from the time of the Buddha‚Äôs appearance in the world until the disappearance of the teachings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yul dang dus kyi khyad par dag la ltos nas 'dul ba'i skye bo dag gi thad nas gshegs nas mi 'dod bzhin du yang dam pa'i chos 'chad par yang mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Lord Buddhas, in dependence on the distinctions of place and time, go to the persons to be trained and, even if they do not wish to, they also teach the excellent doctrine.

original: de la kha cig 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos la ser sna med do chos 'chad pa mdzad du zin kyang chos rnams kyi don dam par ni tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pas don dam pa ma bshad pa'i phyir chos bshad pa'i don rnams
analyzed: de la kha cig 'di snyam du byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos la ser sna med do chos 'chad pa mdzad du zin kyang chos rnams kyi don dam par ni tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pas don dam pa ma bshad pa'i phyir chos bshad pa'i don rnams
translated: In this regard, someone might think, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattvas are not stingy with the doctrine. Even if they do teach the doctrine, since the ultimate of phenomena is not the domain of words, the ultimate is not explained. Therefore, the meanings of the teachings of the doctrine are

original: don med do snyam du sems pa la de'i phyir chos la don yod pa dang don med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don med do snyam du sems pa la de'i phyir chos la don yod pa dang don med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: meaningless.‚Äù In order to dispel that thought, two verses on the meaningfulness and meaninglessness of the doctrine.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i chos rnams la don yod par yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i chos rnams la don yod par yang ma yin /

translated: The Dharma of self-awareness is the realm of phenomena, nonconceptual wisdom, the thirty-seven factors of awakening, and so on, which are realized by the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: ye shes kyi rang gi rig par zad do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang gi rig par zad do //
translated: It is merely self-awareness, wisdom.

original: rang gi rig pa'i chos te tshig dang yi ge bstan du yang med pas gzhan la @224b bstan du mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i chos te tshig dang yi ge bstan du yang med pas gzhan la @224b bstan du mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Since the Dharma of self-awareness cannot be shown by words and letters, it is unsuitable to be shown to others.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma gsungs te tshigs tu bshad pa'i chos kyi nang na don dam pa la sogs pa chos kyi don med pas na chos bshad pa don med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma gsungs te tshigs tu bshad pa'i chos kyi nang na don dam pa la sogs pa chos kyi don med pas na chos bshad pa don med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Bhagavat did not teach it. Among the teachings of the Dharma of explanation, the ultimate and so on are the meaning of the Dharma, so the teaching of the Dharma is said to be meaningless.

original: gal te tshig gi nang na chos kyi rang bzhin yod la chos kyi rang bzhin tshig tu brjod du rung na ni me zhes brjod pa tsam gyis kha tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshig gi nang na chos kyi rang bzhin yod la chos kyi rang bzhin tshig tu brjod du rung na ni me zhes brjod pa tsam gyis kha tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of dharmas were in words, and if the nature of dharmas could be expressed in words, then just by the utterance of the word ‚Äúfire,‚Äù one‚Äôs mouth would be burned.

original: mdo las kyang don dam pa ni brjod du rung bar gang nas kyang ma gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang don dam pa ni brjod du rung bar gang nas kyang ma gsungs te /

translated: And after blessing them, the sound of Dharma teaching also comes from trees, walls, and musical instruments. This is the third kind of Dharma teaching.

original: bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pha gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pha gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses on the perfection of teaching.

original: chos 'chad pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the classification of Dharma teaching,

original: da ni chos 'chad pa'i yon tan 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni chos 'chad pa'i yon tan 'chad de /
translated: now he teaches the excellences of Dharma teaching.üîΩWhen it has four excellences and eight excellences, it is the perfection of teaching.

original: yon tan bzhi dang ldan brgyad dang ldan na bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yon tan bzhi dang ldan brgyad dang ldan na bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To teach this, he composes the second verse.

original: gsal dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩsangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'am /
analyzed: gsal dang zhes bya ba la / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'am /
translated: Clear means

original: dge ba'i bshes @226b gnyen las chos mang du thos nas gzhan dag las dang chos dang don du 'brel pa ston pa ni gsal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes @226b gnyen las chos mang du thos nas gzhan dag las dang chos dang don du 'brel pa ston pa ni gsal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: that, having heard much Dharma from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas or from spiritual friends, one teaches the Dharma to others in a way that is related to the subject, related to the words, and related to the meaning.

original: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is the first excellence.

original: yid gnyis spong ba dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩchos thos pa rnams bsams nas shes rab chung du rnams shes rab 'bring du byas /
analyzed: yid gnyis spong ba dang zhes bya ba la / chos thos pa rnams bsams nas shes rab chung du rnams shes rab 'bring du byas /
translated: Abandoning doubt means

original: shes rab 'bring las shes rab chen por byas te /
analyzed: shes rab 'bring las shes rab chen por byas te /
translated: that, having heard the Dharma, one reflects on it, and then, with middling wisdom, one attains great wisdom.

original: bdag nyid kyang chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom med par gyur cing gzhan yang chos kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba gcod par byed pa ni yid gnyis spong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom med par gyur cing gzhan yang chos kyi mtshan nyid la the tshom za ba gcod par byed pa ni yid gnyis spong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Having attained great wisdom, one is free of doubt with regard to the characteristics of phenomena, and one also eliminates the doubts of others with regard to the characteristics of phenomena. This is called abandoning doubt.

original: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second quality.

original: 'jebs shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jebs shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pleasant means

original: bdag srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa'i yang dag pa'i las la gnas pas gzhan la chos bshad na de bzhin du nyan du btub pa ni 'jebs ba zhes bya ste 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bdag srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa'i yang dag pa'i las la gnas pas gzhan la chos bshad na de bzhin du nyan du btub pa ni 'jebs ba zhes bya ste 'di ni yon tan rnam pa gsum pa'o //
translated: that if one explains the Dharma to others while abiding in the correct actions of not taking life and so forth, they will be able to listen in the same way. This is called pleasant. This is the third quality.üîΩThe two that are taught are

original: de nyid gnyis ston pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis ston pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: the two means

original: de nyid gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i de nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i de nyid de de nyid ston pas na de nyid ston pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i de nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i de nyid de de nyid ston pas na de nyid ston pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The two realities are the reality of the addictive and the reality of the purification.

original: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan rnam pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth quality.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩyon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas chos ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la / yon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas chos ston pa ni /
translated: This is the bodhisattva's perfect explanation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The teaching endowed with these four qualities is the perfect explanation of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gsung rab 'jig rten du yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gsung rab 'jig rten du yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The taking up of the holy Dharma means that the bodhisattva, in order to make the scriptures last a long time in the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' las dam pa'i chos mnyan nas ji ltar mnyan pa'i chos gzhan la don dang tshig tu 'brel par 'chad pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' las dam pa'i chos mnyan nas ji ltar mnyan pa'i chos gzhan la don dang tshig tu 'brel par 'chad pa ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Having listened to the holy Dharma from the Tathagata and the Bodhisattvas, to explain to others the Dharma as it has been heard, in terms of both meaning and words, is called upholding the holy Dharma.

original: bdag gi shes rab rnon por byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi shes rab rnon por byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Making one's own wisdom sharp means

original: chos thos pa rnams rig pas bsams nas bsams pa las shes rab chung ngu las shes rab 'bring du byas /
analyzed: chos thos pa rnams rig pas bsams nas bsams pa las shes rab chung ngu las shes rab 'bring du byas /
translated: that, having contemplated the Dharma that has been heard through knowledge, from lesser wisdom one makes one's wisdom become middling.

original: shes rab 'bring las ni shes rab chen por byas nas chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la yid gnyis zab med par gyur pa ni bdag gi shes rab rnon po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'bring las ni shes rab chen por byas nas chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la yid gnyis zab med par gyur pa ni bdag gi shes rab rnon po zhes bya'o //
translated: From middling wisdom one makes it become great, and then one becomes free from doubt about the general and specific characteristics of phenomena. This is called making one's own wisdom sharp.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩbdag nyid yang dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / yang @227a * //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa dang zhes bya ba la / bdag nyid yang dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / yang @227a * //
translated: Performing the deeds of a holy person means

original: dag ba'i nan tan la gnas shing /
analyzed: dag ba'i nan tan la gnas shing /
translated: that one oneself abides in correct morality and correct practice.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos med par byas nas dam pa'i chos 'chad pa ni skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos med par byas nas dam pa'i chos 'chad pa ni skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Explaining the holy Dharma after having damaged morality and made the Dharma of non-offense non-existent is called the activity of a holy being.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas ston pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas ston pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Teaching through affliction and purification.

original: kun rdzob kyi chos ston pa ni nyon mongs pas ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi chos ston pa ni nyon mongs pas ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Teaching conventional phenomena is called teaching through affliction.

original: don dam pa'i chos ston pa ni rnam par byang ba ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos ston pa ni rnam par byang ba ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Teaching ultimate phenomena is called teaching through purification.

original: yang na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa ston pa ni nyon mongs pa ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa ston pa ni nyon mongs pa ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, teaching the truths of suffering and origination is called teaching through affliction.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa ston pa ni rnam par byang ba ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa ston pa ni rnam par byang ba ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Teaching the truths of cessation and path is called teaching through purification.

original: da ni ston skyob las bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi bshad pa dang / tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: da ni ston skyob las bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi bshad pa dang / tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Now, the four kinds of excellence explained in the teaching of the protector are explained in the Questions of Brahma Sutra:

original: chos kyi sbyin pa chen po ston pa rnam pa bzhi 'byung ba dang don gcig tu sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa chen po ston pa rnam pa bzhi 'byung ba dang don gcig tu sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: The four types of teaching the great gift of Dharma are applied to the same topic.

original: de la dang pos ni mang du thos pa'i phyir gsal bar ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dang pos ni mang du thos pa'i phyir gsal bar ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is clear teaching because of much hearing.

original: dang por ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba ste /
analyzed: dang por ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba ste /
translated: The first is upholding the true Dharma,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bas ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa las dam pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis thos te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bas ni mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pa las dam pa'i chos gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis thos te /
translated: and through upholding the true Dharma, one hears the true Dharma, the twelve branches of the scriptures, from preceptors, masters and so on.

original: mang du thos pas gsal bar ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mang du thos pas gsal bar ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Clear teaching is due to much hearing,

original: mang du thos pa rnams la 'khrul par ston pa dang / mi gsal bar ston pa mi srid par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang du thos pa rnams la 'khrul par ston pa dang / mi gsal bar ston pa mi srid par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught that it is impossible for those with much hearing to teach with error or unclearly.

original: gnyis pas ni shes rab che ba'i phyir the tshom spong ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni shes rab che ba'i phyir the tshom spong ba ste /
translated: The second is the elimination of doubt due to great wisdom.

original: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is the elimination of the doubts of others.

original: gnyis pas ni bdag gi shes rab rnon por byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni bdag gi shes rab rnon por byed pa ste /
translated: The second makes one's own wisdom sharp.

original: bdag gi shes rab rnon por byed pas ni shes rab che zhing bdag nyid chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la the tshom med pas gzhan gyi the tshom yang gcod par byed de /
analyzed: bdag gi shes rab rnon por byed pas ni shes rab che zhing bdag nyid chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la the tshom med pas gzhan gyi the tshom yang gcod par byed de /
translated: And by making their wisdom sharp, they have great wisdom and themselves have no doubts about the general and specific characteristics of phenomena, so they also clear away the doubts of others.

original: shes rab rnon po ni bdag la yang the tshom mi 'byung zhing gzhan gyi the tshom yang sel nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum pas ni kha na ma tho ba'i las mi byed pa'i phyir 'jebs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab rnon po ni bdag la yang the tshom mi 'byung zhing gzhan gyi the tshom yang sel nus pa'i phyir ro // gsum pas ni kha na ma tho ba'i las mi byed pa'i phyir 'jebs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: By means of the third, one does not commit any misdeeds.

original: gsum pas ni skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pas ni skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pa ste /
translated: By means of the third, one performs the actions of a holy person.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pas ni bdag nyid yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas shing /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i las byed pas ni bdag nyid yang dag pa'i yon tan la gnas shing /
translated: By performing the actions of a holy person, one oneself abides in the true virtues and,

original: tshul khrims nyams pa med pas bdag gis ji skad thos pa rnams gzhan la bshad cing @227b bsgo na yang nyan du btub cing tshig btsun pas na 'jebs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa med pas bdag gis ji skad thos pa rnams gzhan la bshad cing @227b bsgo na yang nyan du btub cing tshig btsun pas na 'jebs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: since one's morality is not impaired, one is able to explain to others what one has heard and to make them listen.

original: bzhi pas ni de kho na nyid gnyis ston te /
analyzed: bzhi pas ni de kho na nyid gnyis ston te /
translated: By means of the fourth, one teaches the two realities.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of the characteristic of affliction and the characteristic of purification.

original: bden pa gnyis la bden pa gnyis gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la bden pa gnyis gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: In regard to the two truths, there are two of each.

original: bzhi pa ni nyon mongs ba dang rnam par byang ba ston pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni nyon mongs ba dang rnam par byang ba ston pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the teaching of affliction and purification.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ston pas ni de kho na nyid gnyis ston pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ston pas ni de kho na nyid gnyis ston pa ste /
translated: The teaching of affliction and purification teaches the two realities.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The reality of the characteristic of affliction and the reality of the characteristic of purification.

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: Among them, conventional truth is the reality of the characteristic of affliction.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: Ultimate truth is the reality of the characteristic of purification.

original: yang bden pa bzhi las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang bden pa bzhi las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, from among the four truths, the two truths of suffering and origination are called the reality of the characteristic of affliction.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis ni rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: The two truths of cessation and path are called the reality of purification.

original: gong du bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes glengs pa las bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes glengs pa las bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The excellence of teaching was mentioned above as being shown by two verses. The excellence of teaching as shown in one verse has been explained.

original: de bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa ston pa de 'chad de de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa ston pa de 'chad de de'i phyir /
translated: Now the excellence of teaching as shown in the second verse will be explained.

original: sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni //
analyzed: sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni //
translated: The teaching of the supreme beings

original: 'jam zhing rgyags bral mi skyo yi //
analyzed: 'jam zhing rgyags bral mi skyo yi //
translated: is gentle, not arrogant, not disheartened,

original: gsal zhing sna tshogs rigs go byed //
analyzed: gsal zhing sna tshogs rigs go byed //
translated: clear, various, reasonable,

original: zang zing med cing kun du 'gro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zang zing med cing kun du 'gro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: nonmaterialistic, and universal.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bshad pa yon tan dgu dang ldan pas na bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bshad pa yon tan dgu dang ldan pas na bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the bodhisattvas is excellent because it has nine good qualities.

original: yon tan dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine good qualities?

original: 'jam pa dang / rgyags pa dang / bral ba dang / mi skyo ba dang / gsal ba dang / sna tshogs dang / rigs pa dang / go bar byed pa dang / zang zing med pa dang ; kun du 'gro ba dang / gzhan gyis brgal kyang tshig rtsub po mi 'byin pas na 'jam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam pa dang / rgyags pa dang / bral ba dang / mi skyo ba dang / gsal ba dang / sna tshogs dang / rigs pa dang / go bar byed pa dang / zang zing med pa dang ; kun du 'gro ba dang / gzhan gyis brgal kyang tshig rtsub po mi 'byin pas na 'jam pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is gentle, not haughty, not wearied, clear, varied, reasonable, intelligible, disinterested, universal, and not harsh even when opposed by others.

original: chos 'chad pa'i dus sam chos kyi don la brtson pa'i dus na gzhan dag gis nor pa dang 'khrul pa dang mi rung ngo zhes tshig rtsub po dang mi snyen pa smras kyang sngar lan tshig rtsub po dang brlang @228a * //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i dus sam chos kyi don la brtson pa'i dus na gzhan dag gis nor pa dang 'khrul pa dang mi rung ngo zhes tshig rtsub po dang mi snyen pa smras kyang sngar lan tshig rtsub po dang brlang @228a * //
translated: It is gentle because when one is expounding the Dharma or striving to understand the meaning of the Dharma, even if others speak harshly and unpleasantly, saying that one is mistaken, confused, and unsuitable, one does not respond with harsh and rude words.

original: pos lan mi ldon pas na 'jam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pos lan mi ldon pas na 'jam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus it is called gentle.

original: grub pa dang ba ste dpa'i tshe rgyags pa la mi gnas bas na /üîΩrgyags ba dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grub pa dang ba ste dpa'i tshe rgyags pa la mi gnas bas na /üîΩrgyags ba dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not haughty because one does not become haughty when one has attained success.üîΩIt is not wearied because one does not become weary when one has attained success.

original: chos kyi don dka' ba dag khong du chud cing ji ltar khong du chud pa de gzhan la ston cing sgrub pa na /üîΩbdag gi phyogs grub par gyur kyang /
analyzed: chos kyi don dka' ba dag khong du chud cing ji ltar khong du chud pa de gzhan la ston cing sgrub pa na / bdag gi phyogs grub par gyur kyang /
translated: When they have understood the difficult points of the Dharma and are teaching and practicing so as to help others understand them,üîΩthey do not think, ‚ÄúI have understood the difficult points of the Dharma.‚ÄùüîΩThey do not become proud or arrogant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis khong du chud par dka' pa'i don dag bsgrubs so snyam du mi byed sems kyis rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / gang gi tshe gzhan dag la chos zab mo bshad nas gzhan dag dga' bar 'gyur te khyod ni mkhas pa'o shin tu gsal zhing legs par smra ba'o zhes bstod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du bdag gis khong du chud par dka' pa'i don dag bsgrubs so snyam du mi byed sems kyis rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / gang gi tshe gzhan dag la chos zab mo bshad nas gzhan dag dga' bar 'gyur te khyod ni mkhas pa'o shin tu gsal zhing legs par smra ba'o zhes bstod pa dang /
translated: When they explain the profound Dharma to others and others are pleased and praise them, saying, ‚ÄúYou are learned, very clear, and speak well,‚ÄùüîΩthey do not become conceited or arrogant.

original: sems khengs shing nga rgyal mi skye bas na rgyags pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems khengs shing nga rgyal mi skye bas na rgyags pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are free from pride.

original: ngal ba med pa'i phyir mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngal ba med pa'i phyir mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: They do not arise because they are tireless.

original: ngal ba ni sems zhum zhing yi chad pa dang / chos 'chad pa'i tshe lus na zhing mi bde ba ste /
analyzed: ngal ba ni sems zhum zhing yi chad pa dang / chos 'chad pa'i tshe lus na zhing mi bde ba ste /
translated: They are not tired because they are not discouraged or disheartened and because they do not become physically ill when they teach the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'chad pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'chad pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattva teaches the Dharma,

original: de lta bu med pas na mi skyo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu med pas na mi skyo ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gal te bslab pa las 'das na yang de las 'das phan chad sgo gzhan la 'jug cing 'byung bar bya ba'i thabs ye med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Even if one transgresses the precepts, there is no total absence of means for transcending that and for engaging in and emerging through other doors.

original: bslab tshig las 'das te bslab pa nyams na yang bshags pa dang phyis mi bya bar bsdams pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa rnam grangs kyi sgo gzhan la 'jug cing khams gsum las 'byung bar bya ba'i thabs ston pas na mi brlang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bslab tshig las 'das te bslab pa nyams na yang bshags pa dang phyis mi bya bar bsdams pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa rnam grangs kyi sgo gzhan la 'jug cing khams gsum las 'byung bar bya ba'i thabs ston pas na mi brlang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Even if one transgresses the precepts and impairs them, there is confession, restraint, and the other means for engaging in other categories such as rejoicing in merit and these are taught as the means for emerging from the three worlds.

original: theg pa gsum ston pa'i phyir shin tu 'dul ba'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩnyan thos kyi theg pas 'dul ba rnams la nyan thos kyi theg ba ston /
analyzed: theg pa gsum ston pa'i phyir shin tu 'dul ba'o zhes bya ba la / nyan thos kyi theg pas 'dul ba rnams la nyan thos kyi theg ba ston /
translated: It is very disciplined because it teaches the three vehicles.üîΩIt teaches the sravaka vehicle to those who are disciplined by the sravaka vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'dul ba rnams la rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ston /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'dul ba rnams la rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ston /
translated: it teaches the pratyekabuddha vehicle to those who are disciplined by the pratyekabuddha vehicle,

original: theg pa chen pos 'dul ba rnams la theg pa chen po ston pas na shin tu 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos 'dul ba rnams la theg pa chen po ston pas na shin tu 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a very good discipline because it teaches the Great Vehicle to those who are to be disciplined by the Great Vehicle.

original: g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i phyir rnar snyan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i phyir rnar snyan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is pleasing to the ear, as an antidote to distraction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni shin tu 'jam zhing snyan pa yin pas nyan pa'i sems g-yeng ba med pa dang / rna blags te nyan par byed pas na rna bar snyan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni shin tu 'jam zhing snyan pa yin pas nyan pa'i sems g-yeng ba med pa dang / rna blags te nyan par byed pas na rna bar snyan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathagata's speech is very gentle and pleasing, so that the mind listening is undistracted and listens with rapt attention.

original: ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir lus sim par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa'i phyir lus sim par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is refreshing to the body, as a means of producing samadhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de thos na sems mnyam @233b par 'jog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de thos na sems mnyam @233b par 'jog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When one hears that speech of the Tathagata, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam bar gzhag pa las zhig nas kyi mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skye'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam bar gzhag pa las zhig nas kyi mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skye'o //
translated: From the mind becoming concentrated, samadhi arises, which has the characteristic of non-dissipation.

original: ting nge 'dzin skyes na lus la bde ba skye bar byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin skyes na lus la bde ba skye bar byed do //
translated: When samadhi arises, it produces bliss in the body.

original: de bas na lus sim par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lus sim par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called refreshing to the body.

original: lhag mthong gi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir sems dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir sems dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It delights the mind because it generates the joy of insight.

original: gsung des shes rab kyi mtshan nyid chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral pa'i lhag mthong gi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /üîΩsems dga' bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung des shes rab kyi mtshan nyid chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral pa'i lhag mthong gi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir / sems dga' bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It delights the mind because it generates the joy of insight, which is the characteristic of wisdom, through skill in the general and specific characteristics of things, and through freedom from the darkness of ignorance.

original: the tshom gcod par byed pa'i phyir sems dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: the tshom gcod par byed pa'i phyir sems dga' bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It delights the mind because it cuts off doubt.

original: ji tsam du the tshom gyi zug rdu zug pa de tsam du yid mi bde ba yin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis ni de bzhin du the tshom gyi zug rdu 'byin par byed pas na snying dga' bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du the tshom gyi zug rdu zug pa de tsam du yid mi bde ba yin pa las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis ni de bzhin du the tshom gyi zug rdu 'byin par byed pas na snying dga' bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To the extent that one is pierced by the dart of doubt, one is unhappy. But the speech of the Tathagata removes the dart of doubt in just that way, and thus it is said to delight the mind.

original: log par 'dzin pa spong ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la log par 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: log par 'dzin pa spong ba'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la log par 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It generates joy and happiness because it eliminates wrong grasping. There are two kinds of wrong grasping:

original: mi shes pa dang log par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang log par shes pa'o //
translated: ignorance and wrong understanding.

original: de la mi shes pa ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid thams cad nas thams cad du khong du ma chud pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid thams cad nas thams cad du khong du ma chud pa ste /
translated: Among these, ignorance is the non-comprehension of all the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: de dag gi mi shes pa spong zhing shes pa la 'jog par mdzad pas na dga' ba skyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mi shes pa spong zhing shes pa la 'jog par mdzad pas na dga' ba skyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the Tathagata eliminates their ignorance and establishes them in knowledge, he is called the producer of joy.

original: log par shes pas ni bdag dang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yod par shes pa ste /
analyzed: log par shes pas ni bdag dang rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yod par shes pa ste /
translated: Wrong understanding is the understanding that the self, permanence, happiness, etc. exist.

original: de dag gi log pa'i shes pa spong zhing yang dag pa'i shes pa la 'god pas ni bde ba skyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi log pa'i shes pa spong zhing yang dag pa'i shes pa la 'god pas ni bde ba skyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he eliminates their wrong understanding and establishes them in right understanding, he is called the producer of happiness.

original: sgrub pa 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrub pa 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the absence of regret in practice, he is the absence of regret.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung thos nas mnyan pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bsgrubs na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung thos nas mnyan pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bsgrubs na /
translated: Having heard the Tathagata's teachings, if one practices by listening, reflection, etc.,

original: mthar 'bras bu 'thob cing de kho na mngon sum du rtogs par gyur pas bdag gis gsung de mnyan pa ni don med par byas so snyam pa'i mi dga' ba dang / 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar 'bras bu 'thob cing de kho na mngon sum du rtogs par gyur pas bdag gis gsung de mnyan pa ni don med par byas so snyam pa'i mi dga' ba dang / 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: remorse.üîΩ Because it is the basis for the perfection of the wisdom of listening, it

original: thos pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas kyi phyir kun shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thos pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas kyi phyir kun shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: says, it should be understood.üîΩ If one listens to and hears that speech of the TathƒÅgata, the perfection

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de mnyan cing thos na thos pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de mnyan cing thos na thos pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: of the wisdom of listening will arise.üîΩ Because it is the cause and basis for the arising of the perfection of theüîΩwisdom of listening, it is called that which should be understood.

original: thos pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye ba'i rgyu dang gnas su gyur pa'i @234a * //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye ba'i rgyu dang gnas su gyur pa'i @234a * //
translated: Because it is the basis for the perfection of the wisdom of reflection, it

original: phyir kun shes par bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir kun shes par bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: says, it should be known.

original: bsam pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i gnas kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the basis for the perfection of the wisdom of cultivation, itüîΩsays, it should be realized.

original: ji ltar mnyan pa'i chos de rig pa'i sgo nas bsams pas na bsam pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mnyan pa'i chos de rig pa'i sgo nas bsams pas na bsam pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye ste /
translated: Since one listens to the Dharma and reflects on it with the door of knowledge, the perfection of the wisdom of reflection arises.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye ba'i rgyu dang gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rnam par shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab phun sum tshogs pa skye ba'i rgyu dang gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rnam par shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be cognized because it is the cause and basis for the arising of the perfection of the wisdom of reflection.

original: slob dpon gyis 'chab pa med pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'chab pa med pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The master is clear because he teaches the Dharma without concealment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kha cig 'chad kha cig mi 'chad ces bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kha cig 'chad kha cig mi 'chad ces bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the Tathagata teaches some dharmas and not others.

original: chos thams cad 'chad pa dang / tshig 'chad don mi 'chad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'chad pa dang / tshig 'chad don mi 'chad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: He teaches all dharmas, and not just the words but also the meaning.

original: tshig dang don du bcas te 'chad pas slob dpon 'chab pa med par ston pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig dang don du bcas te 'chad pas slob dpon 'chab pa med par ston pa'i phyir rnam par gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because the master teaches without concealment, he is called clear.

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa dag dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa dag dga' bar byed pa'i phyir dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is delightful because it delights those who have attained their own goal.

original: 'phags pa rgyun du zhugs pa nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa rgyun du zhugs pa nas /
translated: The noble stream-enterers,

original: dgra bcom pa man chad gang zag brgyad dang sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa man chad gang zag brgyad dang sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa dag ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The eight persons from the stream-enterer up to the arhat, the bodhisattvas on the tenth level and the tathagatas are said to have attained their own aim.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag brgyad kyis kyang nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byas na ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag brgyad kyis kyang nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byas na ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The eight persons, the stream-enterer and so on, have attained their own aim, because they have directly realized nirvana, which is characterized by the elimination of the afflictions of the afflictions, the afflictions of karma and the afflictions of birth.

original: sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pas kyang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pas na bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pas kyang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pas na bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the tenth level and the tathagatas have attained their own aim because they have completed the accumulations of merit and wisdom and have acquired the perfect benefit for themselves and others.

original: bdag de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi sgo nas 'bras bu thob par mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi sgo nas 'bras bu thob par mthong ste /
translated: One sees oneself as attaining the result through the Tathagata's teaching,

original: dga' ba skyed par byed pas na dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba skyed par byed pas na dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and one generates joy. Thus it is called joy.

original: bdag gi don ma thob pa rnams sred pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi don ma thob pa rnams sred pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the desire for the non-attainment of one's own aim, because of craving.

original: bdag gi don ma thob pas ni so so'i skye bo yan chad mos pa spyod pa'i sa yan chad 'jig rten gyi chos mchog ma thob pa man chad pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi don ma thob pas ni so so'i skye bo yan chad mos pa spyod pa'i sa yan chad 'jig rten gyi chos mchog ma thob pa man chad pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-attainment of one's own aim is the stage of the common man and above, up to the stage of action in faith and above, up to the supreme worldly dharmas.

original: de dag kyang bdag gi don rjes su thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag gi don rjes su thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And they, in order to attain their own aim,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la 'jug par 'dod pa skyed par byed pas na mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la 'jug par 'dod pa skyed par byed pas na mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: generate the desire to enter into the Tathagata's teaching. Thus it is called desire.

original: bsam du med @234b pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam du med @234b pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the desire to understand, because it teaches the inconceivable Dharma.

original: so so rang gis rig par bya ba chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni bsam du med pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya ba chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni bsam du med pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
translated: The dharmadhatu, nonconceptual gnosis and the elements leading to enlightenment, which are to be realized personally, are called the inconceivable Dharma.

original: chos de dag yang dag par ston par byed pas na kun shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag yang dag par ston par byed pas na kun shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they teach these Dharmas perfectly, they are called the ones who cause all to be known.

original: yang na chos gang bsams na khrag tu skyug cing smyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag ni bsam du med pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na chos gang bsams na khrag tu skyug cing smyo bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag ni bsam du med pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the Dharmas that cause one to vomit blood and go mad when one thinks about them are called the inconceivable Dharmas.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: phyi'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
translated: The inconceivable karma that creates the various kinds of external things, the inconceivable domain of the yogis' concentration, the inconceivable domain of the Tathagata's gnosis,

original: sman dang sngags kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: sman dang sngags kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: and the inconceivable power of medicine and mantra.

original: chos de dag yang dag par bstan pas nyan pa po rnams gnas de dag spong bar byed pas na /
analyzed: chos de dag yang dag par bstan pas nyan pa po rnams gnas de dag spong bar byed pas na /
translated: Because those dharmas are correctly taught, and because those who listen to them abandon those states,

original: kun shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called ‚Äúcausing understanding.‚Äù

original: bsam pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it correctly teaches the dharmas of reflection, it is called ‚Äúcausing knowledge.‚Äù

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsam pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsam pa'i chos zhes bya ste /
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense bases, stages, and perfections are called the dharmas of reflection.

original: chos de dag phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because those dharmas are taught without error, it is called ‚Äúcausing knowledge.‚Äù

original: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir rigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is not in contradiction with valid cognition, it is called ‚Äúreasonable.‚Äù

original: gsung de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad ma gsum dang yang mi 'gal bar gsungs pas na rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung de mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad ma gsum dang yang mi 'gal bar gsungs pas na rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because that speech is taught without contradicting the three valid cognitions of direct perception, inference, and scripture, it is called ‚Äúreasonable.‚Äù

original: 'dul ba la ji ltar rigs par ston pa'i phyir mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dul ba la ji ltar rigs par ston pa'i phyir mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it teaches in accordance with the discipline, it is called ‚Äúappropriate.‚Äù

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams la theg pa chen po mi ston /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams la theg pa chen po mi ston /
translated: They do not teach the Great Vehicle to those of the Hearers' Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po rnams la nyan thos kyi theg pa mi ston te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po rnams la nyan thos kyi theg pa mi ston te /
translated: They do not teach the Hearers' Vehicle to those of the Great Vehicle.

original: snod dang chos su mi 'tsham pa mi ston gyi sems can gang la chos gang bstan par rigs pa'i sems can de la chos de ston te /
analyzed: snod dang chos su mi 'tsham pa mi ston gyi sems can gang la chos gang bstan par rigs pa'i sems can de la chos de ston te /
translated: They do not teach what is not suitable as a vessel or as the Dharma. They teach the Dharma to those sentient beings to whom it is suitable to teach the Dharma.

original: snod dang chos su 'tsham par ston pas na mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snod dang chos su 'tsham par ston pas na mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they teach what is suitable as a vessel and as the Dharma, it is called ‚Äúsuitable.‚Äù

original: dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zlos pa'i nyes ba spangs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir zlos pa'i nyes ba spangs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it has a purpose, it is free from the fault of repetition.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa dang mun pa dang mun nag dang / gti mug ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs kyi tshig smos pa rnams la zlos pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mun pa dang mun nag dang / gti mug ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs kyi tshig smos pa rnams la zlos pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The terms ‚Äúignorance,‚Äù ‚Äúdarkness,‚Äù ‚Äúblackness,‚Äù ‚Äúdelusion,‚Äù and so on, are synonyms. They are not faults of repetition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
