original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dus thams cad du dgongs pa rtse gcig tu 'jog pa yin pas /üîΩchos 'di 'dra ba zhig brjod pas bshad du med do bsnyel ba med pas na zur chag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dus thams cad du dgongs pa rtse gcig tu 'jog pa yin pas / chos 'di 'dra ba zhig brjod pas bshad du med do bsnyel ba med pas na zur chag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathagata is always in a state of one-pointed concentration,üîΩso he never fails to speak when he should, because he never forgets.

original: yang na chos 'di 'dra ba zhig bshad par bya'o zhes dgongs pa la bshad pa'i dus na bsnyel nas ma bshad pa mi mnga' bas na zur chag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chos 'di 'dra ba zhig bshad par bya'o zhes dgongs pa la bshad pa'i dus na bsnyel nas ma bshad pa mi mnga' bas na zur chag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, he never fails to speak at the right time, because he never forgets to speak when he intends to speak.

original: 'dul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir tshang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir tshang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is complete because he always remains in the activity of taming beings.

original: 'dul ba'i bya ba ni sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams bskyed pa dang / bskyed pa rnams 'phel zhing brtas par bya ba dang / 'phel zhing brtas pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba ni 'dul ba'i bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i bya ba ni sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams bskyed pa dang / bskyed pa rnams 'phel zhing brtas par bya ba dang / 'phel zhing brtas pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba ni 'dul ba'i bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The activity of taming is the activity of taming, which is the generation of the roots of virtue in those who have not generated them, the increase and expansion of those who have generated them, and the liberation of those who have increased and expanded.

original: 'dul ba'i bya ba rnams la skad cig kyang mi yol bar de dag gi don ji ltar bya zhes dus thams cad du dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pas na tshang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i bya ba rnams la skad cig kyang mi yol bar de dag gi don ji ltar bya zhes dus thams cad du dgongs pa nye bar gzhag pas na tshang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he is always attentive, thinking How can I do what is to be done for their welfare? without ever missing a moment for the activities of taming, he is called the one who is never lacking in attentiveness.üîΩHe is called the one who is never lacking in attentiveness because he is never lacking in the attentiveness of thinking How can I do what is to be done for their welfare? without ever missing a moment for the activities of taming.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa'i phyir ma chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa'i phyir ma chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is not attached because he does not rely on gain and honor.

original: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: Gain is Dharma robes and so forth.

original: bkur sti ni bstod pa dang phyag bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩde dag la ma chags ma zhen pas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni bstod pa dang phyag bya ba la sogs pa ste / de dag la ma chags ma zhen pas na ma chags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Honor is praise, prostrations, and so forth.üîΩSince he is not attached, not clinging to those, he is called ‚Äúthe one who is not attached.‚Äù

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ma zhum pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ma zhum pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is not timid because he is fearless.

original: chos 'chad pa'i dus na mu stegs pas brgal na mi thub pa'o snyam pa'i 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas na mi zhum pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i dus na mu stegs pas brgal na mi thub pa'o snyam pa'i 'jigs pa mi mnga' bas na mi zhum pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not discouraged because he is not afraid when he is questioned by non-Buddhists when he is teaching the Dharma.

original: mi skyo ba'i phyir dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi skyo ba'i phyir dga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is delightful because he is not wearied.

original: chos 'chad pa mdzad kyang thugs skyo ba dang sku la mi bde ba mi mnga' bas na dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa mdzad kyang thugs skyo ba dang sku la mi bde ba mi mnga' bas na dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is delightful because he is not wearied either physically or mentally when he is teaching the Dharma.

original: @237a * // rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par zhugs pa'i phyir rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @237a * // rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par zhugs pa'i phyir rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is extensive because he is skilled in all the branches of learning.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la chos 'chad pa mdzad pas na rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga thams cad la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la chos 'chad pa mdzad pas na rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is extensive because he teaches the Dharma to those who are skilled in all five branches of learning.

original: sems can la don de thams cad bsgrubs pa'i phyir tha ba dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can la don de thams cad bsgrubs pa'i phyir tha ba dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is accompanied by austerity because he accomplishes all those aims for sentient beings.

original: sems can gang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa de dag thams cad ni tha ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa de dag thams cad ni tha ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who have generated the roots of virtue are called ‚Äúthose who are without austerity.‚Äù

original: bcas pa'i sgras ni tha ba med pa yang bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bcas pa'i sgras ni tha ba med pa yang bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse includes those who are with austerity.

original: sems can tha ba dang bcas pa rnams la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i don sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sems can tha ba dang bcas pa rnams la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i don sgrub par byed do //
translated: For sentient beings who are hostile, he accomplishes the aim of producing the root of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba brtas pa dang / 'phel bar byed de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba brtas pa dang / 'phel bar byed de /
translated: For those who have produced the root of virtue, he causes the root of virtue to grow and increase.

original: de bas na tha ba dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tha ba dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the one with the root of virtue.

original: rgyun ma chad pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyun ma chad pa'i phyir zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is called ‚Äúengaged‚Äù because he is uninterrupted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa na bar 'ga' ni sems can la chos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa na bar 'ga' ni sems can la chos bshad par bya'o //
translated: When the Tathagata teaches the Dharma, he does not think, ‚ÄúSometimes I will teach the Dharma to sentient beings, and sometimes I will not.‚Äù

original: bar 'ga' ni mi bshad do snyam du dgongs pa med par rgyun du 'chad par mdzad pas na zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni mi bshad do snyam du dgongs pa med par rgyun du 'chad par mdzad pas na zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He teaches continuously, and therefore he is called ‚Äúengaged.‚ÄùüîΩOr, when he teaches the Dharma, he does not teach once and then stop, and then teach again after a while.

original: yang na chos 'chad pa'i tshe lan cig bshad nas rgyun bcad de thag gi tsam gzhes nas yang 'chad par mdzad pa med kyi tshig dang gsung gi rgyun ma 'chad par mdzad pas zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chos 'chad pa'i tshe lan cig bshad nas rgyun bcad de thag gi tsam gzhes nas yang 'chad par mdzad pa med kyi tshig dang gsung gi rgyun ma 'chad par mdzad pas zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He teaches without interruption, and therefore he is called ‚Äúengaged.‚Äù

original: rnam pa sna tshogs la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir rol pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir rol pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is a display because it is applied to various aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa ni tshig dang yi ge dang ming gcig gi sgo nas 'chad par mdzad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa ni tshig dang yi ge dang ming gcig gi sgo nas 'chad par mdzad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: When the Tathagata expounds the Dharma, he does not do so by means of a single word, syllable or name.

original: tshig dang ming dang yi ge sna tshogs mang po'i sgo nas 'chad par mdzad pas na rol pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig dang ming dang yi ge sna tshogs mang po'i sgo nas 'chad par mdzad pas na rol pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He expounds it by means of many different words, names and syllables, and for that reason it is called a display.

original: gsung gcig la sgra mang po'i rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dbyangs thams cad rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsung gcig la sgra mang po'i rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dbyangs thams cad rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the perfection of all melodies because it is the basis for the knowledge of many sounds in a single voice.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig phyung ste gsung gi rang bzhin gcig kho nar zad mod kyi gcig po de las lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang / mi dang byol song dang / yi dag sa la sogs pa so so'i sgra dang skad gang yin pa de dang mthun mthun du so sor thos pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsung gcig phyung ste gsung gi rang bzhin gcig kho nar zad mod kyi gcig po de las lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang / mi dang byol song dang / yi dag sa la sogs pa so so'i sgra dang skad gang yin pa de dang mthun mthun du so sor thos pas na /
translated: The Tathagata emits a single voice, a single nature of speech, but from that single voice, each being hears it in his or her own language, such as divine, naga, yaksha, human, animal, hungry ghost, etc.

original: dbyangs thams cad rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs thams cad rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason it is called the perfection of all melodies.

original: gcig gis don mang po chud pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig gis don mang po chud pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the basis for the retention of many meanings in one.

original: dbang po thams cad mgu ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad mgu ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It delights all faculties.üîΩBecause the Tathagata teaches the meaning of the Dharma such as impermanence, etc. in one way, but sentient beings understand it in accordance with their individual mental faculties,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi don gcig bstan @237b na sems can rnams kyis ni so so'i sems kyi chos kyi don gang dang gang la dad pa de bzhin du khong du chud par 'gyur bas na sems can rnams kyi dad pa
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi don gcig bstan @237b na sems can rnams kyis ni so so'i sems kyi chos kyi don gang dang gang la dad pa de bzhin du khong du chud par 'gyur bas na sems can rnams kyi dad pa
translated: in accordance with their faith in the meaning of the Dharma.

original: la sogs pa'i dbang po tshim par byed pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad mgu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i dbang po tshim par byed pa'i phyir dbang po thams cad mgu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it delights all faculties because it satisfies the faculties of sentient beings such as faith.

original: ji ltar dam bcas ba'i phyir mi smad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar dam bcas ba'i phyir mi smad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is irreproachable in terms of what was promised.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dang po ji ltar dam bcas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi mdzad pas na dam pa las nyams so zhes gzhan gyis smad du med pas na mi smad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni dang po ji ltar dam bcas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba mi mdzad pas na dam pa las nyams so zhes gzhan gyis smad du med pas na mi smad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the Tathagata does not act contrary to what he promised in the beginning, he is irreproachable, since he cannot be reproached by others as having lapsed from his vow.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis nga'i chos mnyan te bsgrubs na de bzhin du 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes dam bcas pa la sems can rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' mnyan te bsgrub na dam bcas pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'gyur bas na mi
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis nga'i chos mnyan te bsgrubs na de bzhin du 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes dam bcas pa la sems can rnams kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' mnyan te bsgrub na dam bcas pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'gyur bas na mi
translated: Or else, the Blessed One has promised that if one listens to my Dharma and practices it, one will attain the result in that way. And sentient beings listen to the Blessed One's words and practice them, and attain the result as promised. Therefore, it is called

original: smad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: not contemptible.

original: thob pa'i dus la bab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thob pa'i dus la bab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called immovable because it is endowed with the time of attainment.

original: gnas gang du dus gang gi tshe sems can gang yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus la bab na rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du skad cig kyang mi g-yo bar smin par mdzad pas na mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gang du dus gang gi tshe sems can gang yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus la bab na rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du skad cig kyang mi g-yo bar smin par mdzad pas na mi g-yo ba zhes bya ste /
translated: In whatever place, at whatever time, when the time has come to ripen a sentient being, it ripens like the waves of the ocean, without wavering for a moment. Therefore, it is called immovable.

original: de bas na mdo gzhan dag las kyang dris kyang kha cig ma bshad pa las ma dris kyang kha cig ched du gsungs zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas na mdo gzhan dag las kyang dris kyang kha cig ma bshad pa las ma dris kyang kha cig ched du gsungs zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, in other s≈´tras it is explained that some things are not explained even when asked, while some things are deliberately taught even without being asked.

original: mi rigs par ston pa'i phyir brtan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rigs par ston pa'i phyir brtan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is stable, because it teaches without error.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa ni rings pa dang / rtab por 'chad pa mi mnga' bas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa ni rings pa dang / rtab por 'chad pa mi mnga' bas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathagata's teaching of the Dharma is not hasty or impetuous, and therefore it is said to be stable.

original: ring ba dang nye ba'i 'khor thams cad kyis mtshungs bar thos pa'i phyir 'khor thams cad la gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ring ba dang nye ba'i 'khor thams cad kyis mtshungs bar thos pa'i phyir 'khor thams cad la gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be spoken to the whole assembly, because it is heard equally by the whole assembly, both near and far.üîΩWhen the Tathagata utters the Dharma, it is not the case that the assembly near him hears it and the assembly far away does not hear it as if it were distant.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'chad pa'i gsung phyung ba na 'khor nye ba 'ba' zhig gis thos kyang 'khor thag ring po na gnas pas mi thos pa ma yin gyi de ji ltar drung na gnas pa rnams kyis thos pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams du
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'chad pa'i gsung phyung ba na 'khor nye ba 'ba' zhig gis thos kyang 'khor thag ring po na gnas pas mi thos pa ma yin gyi de ji ltar drung na gnas pa rnams kyis thos pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams du
translated: Just as those near him hear it, so also all those in the world systems in the ten directions, as many as there are in the limits of space in theüîΩthree time periods, hear it as if they were right in front of him.

original: ma'i pha rol na gnas pa thams cad kyis kyang 'di dang 'dra bar thos pas na 'khor thams cad la gsungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma'i pha rol na gnas pa thams cad kyis kyang 'di dang 'dra bar thos pas na 'khor thams cad la gsungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said to be spoken to the whole assembly.

original: 'jig rten gyi don thams cad dpe'i sgo nas bsngos pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don thams cad dpe'i sgo nas bsngos pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is endowed with all aspects because all mundane matters are dedicated by way of example.

original: dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i dus na yang chos kyi don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos rgya mtsho dang ri rab dang nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa dper bzhag nas de dang sbyor zhing 'chad @238a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i dus na yang chos kyi don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos rgya mtsho dang ri rab dang nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa dper bzhag nas de dang sbyor zhing 'chad @238a * //
translated: And when the holy Dharma is being taught, in order to bring about understanding of the meaning of the Dharma, mundane matters such as the ocean, Mount Meru, the sun, the moon, and so on, are presented as examples, and are explained by being applied to them.

original: pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be endowed with all aspects.

original: bshad pa'i bdag nyid che ba la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bshad pa'i bdag nyid che ba la tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Four verses on the greatness of the teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa ni 'bras bu che yon tan che bar tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'chad pa ni 'bras bu che yon tan che bar tshigs su bcad pa bzhis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The teaching of the Tathagata is great in result and great in qualities.üîΩIt is a teaching endowed with words and roots,

original: tshig dang rtsa ba rab ldan bstan pa dang // rnam dbye the tshom gcod pas so //
analyzed: tshig dang rtsa ba rab ldan bstan pa dang // rnam dbye the tshom gcod pas so //
translated: with exposition and with resolution of doubts.

original: rnam pa mang po'i rjes 'gro ba //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po'i rjes 'gro ba //
translated: It is followed by many.

original: brjod pa spros pas shes pa la'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brjod pa spros pas shes pa la'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who understand through elaboration.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rnam pa brgyad ltar chos 'chad de /
translated: The Tathagatas teach the Dharma in eight ways:

original: spros pas shes pa la 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: spros pas shes pa la 'chad pa ste /
translated: They teach the Dharma to those who understand through elaboration.

original: de yang mdo sde dag las 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de yang mdo sde dag las 'chad par byed do //
translated: And this is taught in the sutras.

original: bcas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bcas par byed pa'o //

original: rnam par 'jog go rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog go rnam par 'byed do //
translated: They establish. They analyze.

original: rnam par 'grel to //üîΩgsal bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel to // gsal bar byed do //
translated: They elucidate.üîΩThey clarify.

original: bshad do // rab tu grags so zhes 'byung ba dang rim bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bshad do // rab tu grags so zhes 'byung ba dang rim bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They teach. They make known.

original: de ni 'grel ba las ji ltar sbyar ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'grel ba las ji ltar sbyar ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as it is set forth in the commentary.

original: tshig ni brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig ni brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la /

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag la rigs pa dang ma sbyar ba tshig dang yi ges 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag la rigs pa dang ma sbyar ba tshig dang yi ges 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'chad pa ni brjod pa zhes bya'o //

translated: ‚ÄúTo establish the root‚Äù is to make a rule.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Therefore, in order to make the disciples enter the teaching without fear, and in order to make them understand the selflessness of persons by explaining the existence of the teaching, the Buddha said, ‚ÄúForm exists,‚Äù and so on. This is called the intention to engage.

original: por rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: por rtog pa zhes bya ste /

original: 'dis ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi bstan to //

original: g-yeng ba ni 'byung ba'i sems so zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: phyin ci log la rab tu gnas pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang bdag tu 'dzin pa las phyin ci log pa ste /

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log pa la rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log pa la rab tu gnas pa ste /

original: mi nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ltar yang sa dang po mthong ba'i lam ni rtogs pas 'di ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //

original: rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong nas slar rtag pa la blo ldog cing nyams pa med pas na rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: sa dang por mi rtag pa la sogs pa mthong nas de las nyams pa'i sems mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: nyon mongs pas rab tu nyon mongs pa ni yun ring por dka' ba spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang 'bad pas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba la /

original: sa gnyis nas sa bcu man chad bsgom pa'i lam na mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang brtsal ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa du mas bdag nyid sha thang bar byas pa ni nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /

original: 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam bstan to //

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du rtag pa la sogs pa las phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i chos mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don yang rtogs /

original: bsgom pa'i lam du dka' ba spyod pa du mas nyon mongs na yang sangs rgyas kyi sar bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: chos kyi sku la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ldem po ngag ni sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas 'khor gyi nang dud nyid de'i tshe lhag mthong yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe'am /

analyzed: nga nyid de yin no zhes bka' stsal to //

analyzed: chos kyi sku 'dra ba la dgongs nas nga nyid de yin no zhes bka' stsal to //

analyzed: blta na sdug pa'o //

translated: The antidote to that is the praise of the special qualities of other Buddhas by the Tathagata.

translated: One who, through ignorance, does harm to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and later, remembering that evil, thinks, I have done evil, I have done what is improper,

analyzed: ma nges par dbye ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por nyan thos chen po rnams sangs rgyas su lung bstan par bshad pa dang / theg pa gcig tu bshad pa'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs ma nges pa dag sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod pa las phyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i bshes gnyen gyis nyan thos kyi theg pa la spyod du bcug nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa btang ba ni ma nges pa'i
translated: Those who, having previously practiced the bodhisattva deeds, later, due to the spiritual friend of a ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc., are caused to practice the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle and abandon the bodhisattva deeds, are called ‚Äúthose of unfixed potential.‚Äù

analyzed: de'i gnyen por nyan thos chen po rnams sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dang / theg pa gcig tu zad par bshad do //
translated: The antidote to that is the prediction of the great ≈õrƒÅvakas to buddhahood and the explanation that the vehicles are exhausted in one.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka las theg pa ni gcig tu zad kyi gsum du med do zhes bshad pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa 'tshang rgya ba ma yin yang 'phags pa k'a ty'a ya na theg pa chen po la 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bar lung bstan te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka las theg pa ni gcig tu zad kyi gsum du med do zhes bshad pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa 'tshang rgya ba ma yin yang 'phags pa k'a ty'a ya na theg pa chen po la 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bar lung bstan te /
translated: And he has predicted that the sravakas and so on will not become enlightened, but that the noble Katyayana will become enlightened in the Mahayana.

analyzed: de ltar theg pa gcig tu zad la nyan thos chen po rnams kyang 'tshang rgya na nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhugs pas ci zhig byas dang po nas theg pa chen por zhugs par bya'o zhes theg pa chen po la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the vehicle is exhausted in one and the great sravakas become enlightened, then what is the use of entering the sravaka vehicle? I will enter the Mahayana from the beginning.

original: khams thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba ni theg pa chen po'i gnas su khams rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khams thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba ni theg pa chen po'i gnas su khams rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs la khams zhes bya ste /

original: sgrib pa de dang bral bas theg pa chen po thams cad la mos pa'ang 'thob po zhes sgrib pa brgyad dang bral na theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad la dga' ba dang rangs pa dang mos pa skye ba'i sems 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i donüîΩto // sgo @247a * //
analyzed: sgrib pa de dang bral bas theg pa chen po thams cad la mos pa'ang 'thob po zhes sgrib pa brgyad dang bral na theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad la dga' ba dang rangs pa dang mos pa skye ba'i sems 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // sgo @247a * //
translated: The attainment of faith is the attainment of faith in all the teachings of the universal vehicle, by being free from the eight obscurations. original: gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang gzungs kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang gzungs kyi sgo'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo ni mi zad pa'i za ma tog gi gzungs la sogs pa'o //

original: tshe 'di nyid la bsngags pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la bsngags pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two kinds of praise in this life are praise by gods and praise by men.

original: tshe 'di nyid la bsngags pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la bsngags pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob ste /

analyzed: khams rgyas pa dang 'chi ba'i tshe dga' ba mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: phyi ma la rnam pa brgyad de rim gyis khyad par gyi bye brag 'thob par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de la dus gcig tu cig car mi 'thob kyi yon tan khyad par can rnams 'thob po zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: yang ji ltar na dang po la tshe 'dir khams rgyas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas gar skye bar 'dod pa der skye bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Then, by listening to the Dharma from him, one becomes endowed with faith through being endowed with intelligence.

original: de nas sgo gnyis thob pas mjug tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sgo gnyis thob pas mjug tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //

original: yang na rjes su bsngags pa de dag rim gyis thob par nges pa med kyi 'chol bar 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na rjes su bsngags pa de dag rim gyis thob par nges pa med kyi 'chol bar 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, there is no certainty that one will obtain those praises in order; the meaning is that one will obtain them in a random way.

original: bshad pa bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'di yan chad du chos btsal ba dang / chos bshad pa dang / chos bshad pa la yi ge phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig phun sum tshogs pa dang / dgongs pa dang ldem po ngag la sogs pa bshad nas da ni de dag gi mjug bsdus te chos bshad pa'i bsngags pa dang /
analyzed: bshad pa bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ste zhes bya ba la / 'di yan chad du chos btsal ba dang / chos bshad pa dang / chos bshad pa la yi ge phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig phun sum tshogs pa dang / dgongs pa dang ldem po ngag la sogs pa bshad nas da ni de dag gi mjug bsdus te chos bshad pa'i bsngags pa dang /
translated: The verse praising the explanation.üîΩUp to this point, the search for the Dharma, the explanation of the Dharma, and the excellence of the letters and words in the explanation of the Dharma, as well as the intention, indirect speech, and so on, have been explained. original: yon tan ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rab tu blo gros mi skye snying rje can //
analyzed: rab tu blo gros mi skye snying rje can //
translated: The compassionate one's mind is not born in the highest.

original: grags par bsgrags dang cho ga shes rab ldan //
analyzed: grags par bsgrags dang cho ga shes rab ldan //
translated: He is renowned, eloquent, and wise.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mdzes par smra ba yin /üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mdzes par smra ba yin / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva is a beautiful speaker.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par 'chad par nus pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas na rab tu blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par 'chad par nus pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas na rab tu blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúvery wise‚Äù because he is endowed with the wisdom that is able to explain the characteristics of things without error.

original: bar 'ga' 'chad par 'ga' mi 'chad pa med kyi byang chub rgyun du 'chad pas na mi skyo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar 'ga' 'chad par 'ga' mi 'chad pa med kyi byang chub rgyun du 'chad pas na mi skyo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúinexhaustible‚Äù because he is always explaining enlightenment, without ever being without an opportunity to explain it.

original: khe @247b dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir 'chad pa ma yin pas na snying rje can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khe @247b dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir 'chad pa ma yin pas na snying rje can zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúcompassionate‚Äù because he explains without seeking gain or honor.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan zhing mkhas par grags pas tshig 'jebs shing btsun pas na legs par bsgrags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan zhing mkhas par grags pas tshig 'jebs shing btsun pas na legs par bsgrags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúrenowned‚Äù because he is endowed with the six perfections and is renowned as a scholar, and because his words are sweet and pure.

original: sems can gang la chos gang bstan par rigs pa'i sems can de la chos ston pas chos gang rab tu shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gang la chos gang bstan par rigs pa'i sems can de la chos ston pas chos gang rab tu shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called ‚Äúendowed with the knowledge of the Dharma‚Äù because he teaches the Dharma to those beings to whom it is proper to teach it.

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga ltar chos 'chad pas na mdzes par gsungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga ltar chos 'chad pas na mdzes par gsungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, because he teaches the Dharma in five aspects, he is said to be beautiful.

original: ma nor bar bzang po sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma nor bar bzang po sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that he is good and unerring.

original: dpe ci dang 'dra zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / 'jig rten dag na brjod pa phan pa nyi ma bzhin /
analyzed: dpe ci dang 'dra zhe na / de'i phyir / 'jig rten dag na brjod pa phan pa nyi ma bzhin /
translated: What is the example?üîΩTherefore, he says,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like the sun, he speaks in the world for the benefit.

original: dper na nyi ma 'jig rten dag la phan pa dang dro ba dang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos bstan pa nyi mas kyang 'jig rten la phan pa dang snang bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma 'jig rten dag la phan pa dang dro ba dang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos bstan pa nyi mas kyang 'jig rten la phan pa dang snang bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as the sun benefits the world, warming and illuminating it, so also the sun of the bodhisattva's Dharma teaching benefits and illuminates the world.

original: rgyu lngas mdzes par smra ba nyi ma lta bu ldan pa'i bsngags pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu lngas mdzes par smra ba nyi ma lta bu ldan pa'i bsngags pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The praise of the bodhisattva's possession of beautiful speech like the sun is due to five causes.

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga lta bur chos ston pas na byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba ni mdzes par smra ba yin pas nyi ma dang 'dra bar bsngags te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga lta bur chos ston pas na byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba ni mdzes par smra ba yin pas nyi ma dang 'dra bar bsngags te /
translated: Because he teaches the Dharma in five aspects, the bodhisattva, the Dharma teacher, is beautiful in speech and is praised as being like the sun.

original: dper na nyi ma shar na 'jig rten rnams la phan pa dang / dro ba dang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos bstan pa'i nyi mas kyang 'jig rten la phan pa dang bde ba dang snang bar byed pas na 'jig rten pa dag byang chub sems dpa' la gus pa mang du bskyed do zhes bya
analyzed: dper na nyi ma shar na 'jig rten rnams la phan pa dang / dro ba dang snang bar byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos bstan pa'i nyi mas kyang 'jig rten la phan pa dang bde ba dang snang bar byed pas na 'jig rten pa dag byang chub sems dpa' la gus pa mang du bskyed do zhes bya
translated: For example, when the sun rises, it benefits the world, warms it, and illuminates it. In the same way, the sun of the bodhisattva's teaching of the Dharma benefits, warms, and illuminates the world. Therefore, worldly people generate much respect for the bodhisattva.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: phyin ci ma log par smra ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par smra ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is a speaker of what is unmistaken, it is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de blo gros rab dang ldan pas na 'khrul pa dang phyin ci log tu 'chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de blo gros rab dang ldan pas na 'khrul pa dang phyin ci log tu 'chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because that bodhisattva has the highest intelligence, he does not err or explain things in a distorted way.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa byed pas na blo gros rab dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa byed pas na blo gros rab dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He explains the specific and general characteristics of phenomena without distortion. Therefore, he is called one who has the highest intelligence.

original: rgyun tu dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyun tu dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is constant, it is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'chad pa yang bar 'ga' 'chad par 'ga' mi 'chad pa ma yin gyi rgyun tu 'chad par byed de de bas na mi skyo bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'chad pa yang bar 'ga' 'chad par 'ga' mi 'chad pa ma yin gyi rgyun tu 'chad par byed de de bas na mi skyo bzhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's teaching of the Dharma is not sometimes teaching and sometimes not teaching; he teaches it continuously, and so he is called indefatigable.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: With a mind free of material desire.

original: chos 'chad pa yang sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir chos 'chad kyi /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa yang sems can gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir chos 'chad kyi /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to remove the suffering of sentient beings,

analyzed: khe dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i zang zing la sogs pas 'chad pa ma yin pas na snying rje can zhes bya'o //
translated: and not in order to obtain material goods such as gain, honor, etc. And so he is called compassionate.

original: 'jebs pa'i tshig dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jebs pa'i tshig dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: With words that are pleasing.

original: byang chub sems @248a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems @248a * //
translated: The bodhisattva

original: dpa' de yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par phyogs bcu kun du grags te //
analyzed: dpa' de yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par phyogs bcu kun du grags te //
translated: is endowed with a complete set of good qualities, and is famous in all the ten directions.

analyzed: de'i tshig kun gyis mnyan cing tshig 'jebs par 'gyur bas na grags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: His words are listened to by all, and are pleasing, and so he is called famous.

analyzed: 'dul ba dang mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la 'dul ba'i sems can gang la chos gang bshad par rigs pa'i sems can de la chos 'chad de dper na 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba la sogs pa 'chad pas na cho ga rab dang ldan pa zhes bya'o
translated: In accordance with the Vinaya means that one teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings for whom it is appropriate to explain which Dharma in accordance with the Vinaya. For example, one explains impurity, etc. to those with attachment. Thus, it is said to be endowed with the rite.

original: // chos bshad pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / bshad pa'i skabs kyi rjes la /
analyzed: // chos bshad pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so / // / bshad pa'i skabs kyi rjes la /
translated: The section on explaining the Dharma is complete.

original: bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par ci 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par ci 'brel zhe na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on practice and the section on explaining?

original: bdag gis ji ltar btsal ba'i chos gzhan la bshad na ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar btsal ba'i chos gzhan la bshad na ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa yin la /
translated: If I explain the Dharma that I have sought to others, I accomplish benefit for others.

original: ji ltar btsal ba'i chos de nyid kyi don /
analyzed: ji ltar btsal ba'i chos de nyid kyi don /
translated: If I accomplish the meaning of the Dharma that I have sought,

original: bdag gis bsgrub na ni bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis bsgrub na ni bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: I accomplish benefit for myself.

original: de bas na thos pa mang po dang ldan pa rnams kyis nyan pa nyid kyi chos gzhan la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa mang po dang ldan pa rnams kyis nyan pa nyid kyi chos gzhan la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who possess much learning should explain the Dharma to others by listening to it.

original: bdag nyid la phan par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis kyang bsgrub par bya dgos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid la phan par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis kyang bsgrub par bya dgos te /
translated: And for the sake of benefiting oneself, one must also practice.

original: de bas na bshad pa'i skabs kyi rjes la bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa'i skabs kyi rjes la bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the section on practice is relevant after the section on explanation.

original: yang mig yod par mar me lag na thogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas kyang lam mthong bar 'gyur la long ba mar me thogs pa ni gzhan gyis lam mthong bar zad kyi bdag gis mthong ba la mi phan no //
analyzed: yang mig yod par mar me lag na thogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas kyang lam mthong bar 'gyur la long ba mar me thogs pa ni gzhan gyis lam mthong bar zad kyi bdag gis mthong ba la mi phan no //
translated: Moreover, when a person with eyes holds a lamp, both he and others can see the path. But when a blind person holds a lamp, only others can see the path, not he himself.

original: de dang 'dra ba ji ltar btsal bas chos gzhan la bstan te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ji ltar btsal bas chos gzhan la bstan te /
translated: In the same way, the Dharma is taught for the sake of others by searching for it.

original: bdag gis ma bsgrubs na ni gzhan la phan par zad kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis ma bsgrubs na ni gzhan la phan par zad kyi /
translated: If one does not practice, one can only benefit others,

original: bdag la phan pa med do //
analyzed: bdag la phan pa med do //
translated: but not oneself.

original: de bas na ji ltar btsal ba'i chos gzhan la phan par bya ba'i chos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar btsal ba'i chos gzhan la phan par bya ba'i chos bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Dharma should be taught for the sake of benefiting others by searching for it.

original: bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir ni bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir ni bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: But for the sake of benefiting oneself, one must practice.

original: de bas na bshad pa'i skabs kyi rjes la bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa'i skabs kyi rjes la bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the section on practice is connected to the explanation section.üîΩSix verses on the analysis of practice. The analysis of practice is explained in the scriptures as follows: ‚ÄúHow does one practice in accordance with the Dharma, having understood the meaning?

original: sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug go zhes bya ba mdo sde las sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba bshad pa ni ji ltar don shes pa dang chos la chos kyi rjes su sgrub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshungs par sgrub pa dang chos la rjes su spyod pa zhes 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa drug go zhes bya ba mdo sde las sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba bshad pa ni ji ltar don shes pa dang chos la chos kyi rjes su sgrub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshungs par sgrub pa dang chos la rjes su spyod pa zhes 'byung ba ste /
translated: By practicing in accordance with the Dharma, one becomes a follower of the Dharma.

original: tshig lnga pa de dag gi don tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to //
analyzed: tshig lnga pa de dag gi don tshigs su bcad pa drug gis bstan to //
translated: ‚Äù These five lines are explained by six verses.

original: de la yang don shes pa dang / chos shes pa gnyis ni tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis pas @248b bstan to //
analyzed: de la yang don shes pa dang / chos shes pa gnyis ni tshigs su bcad pa dang po dang gnyis pas @248b bstan to //
translated: Among them, the two lines ‚Äúhaving understood the meaning‚Äù and ‚Äúhaving understood the teaching‚Äù are explained by the first and second verses.

original: chos la chos kyi rjes su sgrub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshungs par 'gyur ba gnyis ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas bstan to //
analyzed: chos la chos kyi rjes su sgrub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshungs par 'gyur ba gnyis ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas bstan to //
translated: The two lines ‚Äúone practices in accordance with the teaching‚Äù and ‚Äúone becomes a follower of the teaching‚Äù are explained by the third and fourth verses.

original: chos la rjes su spyod pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa dang drug pas bstan to //
analyzed: chos la rjes su spyod pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa dang drug pas bstan to //
translated: The fifth and sixth verses show the practice of the Dharma.

original: gang zag chos la blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: gang zag chos la blo ldan gyis //
translated: The wise, who are devoted to the Dharma,

original: bdag med gnyis su shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag med gnyis su shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: know the two kinds of selflessness.

original: blo dang ldan pa ni shes rab ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bya ste /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni shes rab ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bya ste /
translated: The wise refers to the bodhisattvas who have wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des gang zag la yang bdag med pa gnyis su shes so chos la yang bdag med pa gnyis su shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des gang zag la yang bdag med pa gnyis su shes so chos la yang bdag med pa gnyis su shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that those bodhisattvas know the two kinds of selflessness in the person and know the two kinds of selflessness in phenomena.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang zag dang srog dang bdag tu brtag pa'i kun brtags kyi gang zag kyang gzung ba'i ngo bor med pa dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bor med pas bdag med par shes /
analyzed: gang zag dang srog dang bdag tu brtag pa'i kun brtags kyi gang zag kyang gzung ba'i ngo bor med pa dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bor med pas bdag med par shes /
translated: They know the imputed person, imputed as a person, a life-force, or a self, to be selfless, because it does not exist as an apprehended object and does not exist as an apprehending subject.

original: kun brtags kyi chos gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la yang gzung ba'i ngo bor med pa dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bor med pas bdag med par shes so //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chos gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa la yang gzung ba'i ngo bor med pa dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bor med pas bdag med par shes so //
translated: They know the imputed phenomena, such as forms, sounds, and so on, to be selfless, because they do not exist as apprehended objects and do not exist as apprehending subjects.

original: gnyis la log dang ma log pa //
analyzed: gnyis la log dang ma log pa //
translated: The third is the avoidance of the two,

original: rnam par spangs pa gsum pas so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par spangs pa gsum pas so // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the erroneous and the non-erroneous.

original: gnyis ni med pa'i don dang yod pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis ni med pa'i don dang yod pa'i don to //
translated: The two are the non-existent and the existent.üîΩThe three concentrations are the emptiness concentration, the wishless concentration, and the signless concentration.

original: log pa'i rang bzhin yang spangs ma log pa'i rang bzhin yang spangs pa'i stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis med pa'i don dang / yod pa'i don gnyis shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: log pa'i rang bzhin yang spangs ma log pa'i rang bzhin yang spangs pa'i stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis med pa'i don dang / yod pa'i don gnyis shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The two are the non-existent and the existent.

original: de la gnyis ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med pas chos dang gang zag la bdag med par shes so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnyis ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med pas chos dang gang zag la bdag med par shes so // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two are the objective and the subjective.

original: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la bya ste /
translated: The two are the objective and the subjective.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i kun brtags kyi chos kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med pas bdag dang gang zag la sogs pa'i kun du brtags pa'i bdag kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pas na bdag med par shes so zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i kun brtags kyi chos kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin med pas bdag dang gang zag la sogs pa'i kun du brtags pa'i bdag kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pas na bdag med par shes so zhes bya ba'i
translated: The meaning is that one should understand that they are selfless.

original: don to // log pa dang yang dag par spangs pa gsum gyis ni gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don to // log pa dang yang dag par spangs pa gsum gyis ni gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the three that are the abandonment of the incorrect and the correct,üîΩthe meaning of nonexistence and existence is understood.

original: log pa dang yang dag par spangs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis ni med pa dang yod pa'i don shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩkun brtags rang bzhin gnyis med pa la stong pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so zhes bya ba la kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag gi rang @249a * //
analyzed: log pa dang yang dag par spangs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis ni med pa dang yod pa'i don shes so zhes bya ba'i don to // kun brtags rang bzhin gnyis med pa la stong pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so zhes bya ba la kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag gi rang @249a * //
translated: The meaning is that by the three concentrations of emptiness, signlessness, and so on, which have the nature of the abandonment of the incorrect and the correct, the meaning of nonexistence and existence is understood.üîΩBy the concentration of emptiness, the nonexistence of the two natures of the imputed is understood.

original: bzhin med de /
analyzed: bzhin med de /
translated: The imputed phenomena and the imputed person do not have a nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang tha snyad dang / brdar kun du brtags pa thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang tha snyad dang / brdar kun du brtags pa thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all names, signs, conventions, and designations are non-existent like the horns of a rabbit.

original: kun brtags rang bzhin med pa ni stong pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin gyis shes so //
analyzed: kun brtags rang bzhin med pa ni stong pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin gyis shes so //
translated: The imagined nature is known by the emptiness meditative stabilization.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa dang / stong par bsgom pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin yod pa la smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa dang / stong par bsgom pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin yod pa la smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the emptiness meditative stabilization is the aspect of meditating on the emptiness of the imagined phenomena and the person as lacking a self.üîΩThe other-dependent and the perfected are known by the signless and the wishless, respectively.

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa gnyis yod pa de gnyis ni smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis rim bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa gnyis yod pa de gnyis ni smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis rim bzhin du shes so //
translated: The other-dependent and the perfected both exist. Those two are known, respectively, by the signless and the wishless meditative stabilizations.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzhan gyi dbang de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyon can du byas pa yin pas rang bzhin yod du zin kyang smon pa bya ba'i gnas ma
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyon can du byas pa yin pas rang bzhin yod du zin kyang smon pa bya ba'i gnas ma
translated: Since that dependent nature is the basis for the faults of the various sufferings of inaccurate conception and the afflictions such as attachment, it is not a suitable object of aspiration even if it did intrinsically exist.

original: yin zhes smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtogs so //
analyzed: yin zhes smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rtogs so //
translated: This is realized through the concentration of absence of aspiration.üîΩThe fully present nature is not a suitable object for the conception that is characterized by speech, thought, and imagination that thinks, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: yongs su grub pa ni rang bzhin yod la smra ba dang bsam pa dang spro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa dang bral bas 'di 'dra'o zhes mtshan ma brtag tu rung ba ma yin par mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shes so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni rang bzhin yod la smra ba dang bsam pa dang spro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa dang bral bas 'di 'dra'o zhes mtshan ma brtag tu rung ba ma yin par mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shes so //
translated: The concentration of absence of attributes knows that.

original: ting nge 'dzin de gsum 'jig rten gyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de gsum 'jig rten gyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those three concentrations are mundane,

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi'i tshe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa bzhi'i tshe na /
translated: The three concentrations such as emptiness are mundane when they are cultivated on the four levels of the stage of action in faith.

original: bsgom pas 'jig rten pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas 'jig rten pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called mundane because they are cultivated by mundane beings.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la ltos nas ni log pa dang ma log par bzhag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la ltos nas ni log pa dang ma log par bzhag go //
translated: It is posited as mistaken or unmistaken in relation to the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: de la mos pa spyod pa'i sar ma zhugs pa 'jig rten pa la ltos nas ni ma log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa spyod pa'i sar ma zhugs pa 'jig rten pa la ltos nas ni ma log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In relation to the mundane person who has not entered the stage of devoted engagement, it is called unmistaken.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la ltos nas ni log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la ltos nas ni log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In relation to the supramundane path, it is called mistaken.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bskyed pas na phyin ci ma log pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes bskyed pas na phyin ci ma log pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called unmistaken because it generates supramundane wisdom.

original: log pa spangs pa zhes 'chad de /
analyzed: log pa spangs pa zhes 'chad de /
translated: It is explained as the abandonment of error.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa na de ting nge 'dzin de gsum bsgoms te /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa na de ting nge 'dzin de gsum bsgoms te /
translated: On the stage of devoted engagement, one cultivates those three meditative stabilizations.

original: de gsum la bsgoms pa'i rgyus sa dang po thob cing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes khong du chud de /
analyzed: de gsum la bsgoms pa'i rgyus sa dang po thob cing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes khong du chud de /
translated: By the cause of cultivating those three, one attains the first stage and comprehends supramundane wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu byed pas na phyin ci ma log pa @249b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu byed pas na phyin ci ma log pa @249b zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called unmistaken because it acts as the cause of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not real because it is not supramundane.

original: ma log pa spangs pa 'chad de /
analyzed: ma log pa spangs pa 'chad de /
translated: The non-erroneous is excluded.

original: ting nge 'dzin de gsum yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes nyid du ma gyur cing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de gsum yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes nyid du ma gyur cing /
translated: These three concentrations are not the supramundane intuition itself,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas na yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pas na yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: and they are not of the nature of non-discrimination, so they are not authentic.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdon shes pa ni chos kun la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to // don shes pa ni chos kun la //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩThe one who knows the meaning

original: gzings dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzings dang 'dra bar rtogs pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: realizes all things are like a raft.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar nyan pa'i shes rab kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa ni don shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar nyan pa'i shes rab kyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa ni don shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: As explained above, the one who knows the meaning is the one who, by the wisdom of listening, realizes the two kinds of no-self of persons and things.

original: don shes pa de ni 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa las gsungs pa bzhin du chos thams cad gzings dang 'dra bar rtogs te /
analyzed: don shes pa de ni 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa las gsungs pa bzhin du chos thams cad gzings dang 'dra bar rtogs te /
translated: That one who knows the meaning realizes all things are like a raft, as stated in the noble Diamond Cutter:

original: dper na chu bo las bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na chu bo las bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, in order to cross over a river,

original: gzings bca' zhing gru la sogs pa'i gzings la brten te chu bo brgal nas gzings dor ba de bzhin du chos kyi don rtogs par bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos nyan cing /
analyzed: gzings bca' zhing gru la sogs pa'i gzings la brten te chu bo brgal nas gzings dor ba de bzhin du chos kyi don rtogs par bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos nyan cing /
translated: Just as one crosses a river by relying on a raft and then abandons the raft, so too, in order to understand the meaning of the Dharma and abandon the afflictions, one listens to the excellent Dharma and reflects on it and so forth.üîΩBut once one has understood the meaning, one should also abandon those means.

original: bsam pa la sogs pa bya ba yin la don rtogs nas ni de dag kyang 'dor bar bya ba yin par khong du chud pas na gzings dang 'dra bar rtogs so zhes bya bar rtogs te /
analyzed: bsam pa la sogs pa bya ba yin la don rtogs nas ni de dag kyang 'dor bar bya ba yin par khong du chud pas na gzings dang 'dra bar rtogs so zhes bya bar rtogs te /
translated: Thus one should understand that they are like a raft.

original: de yan chad du don shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de yan chad du don shes pa bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the understanding of the meaning has been explained.

original: thos pas dga' ba spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: thos pas dga' ba spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon delight in mere listening,

original: chos shes pas ni des brjod do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos shes pas ni des brjod do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should understand the Dharma through knowing the Dharma.üîΩIn order to abandon delight in mere listening, one should understand the Dharma through knowing the Dharma.

original: de ltar thos pa tsam gyis kyang cho ga par mi bya'i ji ltar thos pa'i chos de dag ma nor bar rig par bsam dgos te /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa tsam gyis kyang cho ga par mi bya'i ji ltar thos pa'i chos de dag ma nor bar rig par bsam dgos te /
translated: Thus one should not be satisfied with mere listening, but one should reflect on those Dharmas as one has heard them, without error.

original: de bas na thos pas 'dzin pa spangs nas bsam pa'i shes rab la gus pa bskyed cing /
analyzed: de bas na thos pas 'dzin pa spangs nas bsam pa'i shes rab la gus pa bskyed cing /
translated: Therefore, having abandoned attachment to listening, one should generate respect for the wisdom of reflection.

original: sems pa la 'jug par byed pa ni chos shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems pa la 'jug par byed pa ni chos shes pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the knowledge of phenomena is the entry to the mind.

original: so sor 'gro ba'i shes pa yis //
analyzed: so sor 'gro ba'i shes pa yis //
translated: By the knowledge of individuals,

original: de bzhin gnyis por rab rtogs na //
analyzed: de bzhin gnyis por rab rtogs na //
translated: having well understood the two,

original: de yi shes pa rdzogs bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi shes pa rdzogs bya'i phyir //
translated: for the sake of perfecting that knowledge,

original: chos kyi rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
translated: one practices in accord with the Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba la so sor 'gro ba ni so so'i skye bo la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la so sor 'gro ba ni so so'i skye bo la bya ste /
translated: An individual is an ordinary being.üîΩAt the time of being an ordinary being, one practices listening, and by the knowledge of phenomena, one understands the meaning.

original: so so'i skye po phal pa'i dus na mnyan pa'i shes rab kyis don shes pa dang / bsam pa'i dus na chos shes pa gnyis la brten nas /
analyzed: so so'i skye po phal pa'i dus na mnyan pa'i shes rab kyis don shes pa dang / bsam pa'i dus na chos shes pa gnyis la brten nas /
translated: Then, at the time of reflection, one practices the two: the knowledge of phenomena and the knowledge of individuals.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa'i ye shes de nyid rdzogs shing dag pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
