translated: Or else, since the phenomena of afflictions such as desire are to be properly taken to mind in the manner of the ultimate, as having the character of emptiness, non-production, and non-occurrence,

original: bsgom pa las grub par gyur na 'dod chags pa'i nyon mongs pa las grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgom pa las grub par gyur na 'dod chags pa'i nyon mongs pa las grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: if one achieves meditation on them, one will be liberated from the affliction of desire.

original: de bas na de la dgongs nas 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags 'byin to zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de bas na de la dgongs nas 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags 'byin to zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Therefore, with that in mind, it is said that desire produces desire.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa spong bar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa spong bar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two verses on the abandonment of the attentions of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis lta zhing 'khor ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyab kyis lta zhing 'khor ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva's attention turns away from nirvana and faces toward cyclic existence.

original: nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs shing /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs shing /
translated: The attention of the disciples turns toward nirvana and faces away from cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba la rgyab tu lta ba yin te de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs shing 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa spang ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to
analyzed: 'khor ba la rgyab tu lta ba yin te de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs shing 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa spang ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon the bodhisattva's attention of the disciples, which turns toward nirvana and away from cyclic existence, two verses are taught.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩji ste 'jig rten @255a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to // ji ste 'jig rten @255a * //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩEven though for the sake of the world

original: phyir ni dmyal ba'i gnas 'jug kyang /üîΩsdug bsngal drag pos rgyal ba'i sras la gnod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyir ni dmyal ba'i gnas 'jug kyang / sdug bsngal drag pos rgyal ba'i sras la gnod mi 'gyur //
translated: he enters the hells,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the powerful son of the victors is not harmed by intense suffering.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don dang phan pa'i ched du sems can dmyal ba'i gnas su 'jug cing dmyal bar gnas kyang dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal bar ma dang tha mas gnod par mi 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos kyi dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don dang phan pa'i ched du sems can dmyal ba'i gnas su 'jug cing dmyal bar gnas kyang dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal bar ma dang tha mas gnod par mi 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos kyi dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal
translated: If bodhisattvas enter the hells for the sake of sentient beings and benefit, they will not be harmed by the suffering of the hells, let alone by the suffering of the intermediate and lower realms.

original: shin tu drag pos kyang de'i lus dang sems la gnod par mi 'gyur zhing bla na med pa'i bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩzhi ba'i yon tan srid skyon thog mar bsam pa yi //
analyzed: shin tu drag pos kyang de'i lus dang sems la gnod par mi 'gyur zhing bla na med pa'i bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // zhi ba'i yon tan srid skyon thog mar bsam pa yi //
translated: Even by the extremely intense suffering of the hells, their bodies and minds will not be harmed and they will not be obstructed from attaining unsurpassable enlightenment.üîΩThe wise are harmed by various thoughts of virtue

original: dge ba rtog pa sna tshogs blo ldan rnams la gnod //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba rtog pa sna tshogs blo ldan rnams la gnod // zhes bya ba la /
translated: that arise from first considering the qualities of peace and the faults of existence.

original: theg dman 'phangs zhes bya ba dang por bshad de theg dman 'phangs pa ni nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: theg dman 'phangs zhes bya ba dang por bshad de theg dman 'phangs pa ni nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa la bya ste /
translated: The first is explained as ‚Äúdeprecating the lesser vehicle,‚Äù which refers to the attentions of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba la /
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba la /
translated: Moreover, in regard to the peace of nirvana,

original: bde ba dang gya nom par yon tan du lta ba dang / srid pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang gya nom par yon tan du lta ba dang / srid pa ste /
translated: The first is to view the three realms as blissful and sublime.üîΩüîΩThe second is to view the three realms as a source of qualities.

original: 'khor ba la sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rtog pa'i yid la byed pa gnyis ni blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa la sogs pa la bya bar rtog pa la gnod cing /
analyzed: 'khor ba la sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rtog pa'i yid la byed pa gnyis ni blo ldan byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa la sogs pa la bya bar rtog pa la gnod cing /
translated: The two attentions that view the three realms as blissful and sublime and that conceive of cyclic existence as suffering are harmful to the wise bodhisattvas who are engaged in the activities of the perfections, the levels and so on.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin pas yid la byed pa de ni spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa yin pas yid la byed pa de ni spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: They are obstacles to attaining unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: / de'i don tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩblo ldan dag ni dri med rnam dag sangs rgyas byang chub la //
analyzed: / de'i don tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pas bstan pa'i phyir / blo ldan dag ni dri med rnam dag sangs rgyas byang chub la //
translated: The meaning of that is stated in the second verse:üîΩThe wise do not create obstacles for anyone

original: dmyal bar gnas pa thams cad dus su bgegs mi byed //
analyzed: dmyal bar gnas pa thams cad dus su bgegs mi byed //
translated: in all the hells for the sake of stainless, pure buddha enlightenment.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te blo ldan dag ni zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te blo ldan dag ni zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wise refers to bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thob par bya ba'i byang chub de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thob par bya ba'i byang chub de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That enlightenment which is to be attained by the bodhisattvas is called stainless because it is the abandonment of all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to the knowable.

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa dang thogs pa med pa'i shes pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rnam par rgyas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa dang thogs pa med pa'i shes pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rnam par rgyas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called expanded because it is the knowledge of all things, the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all knowable things.

original: dri ma med pa zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan /
analyzed: dri ma med pa zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan /
translated: By the term stainless, the perfection of abandonment is indicated.

original: rnam rgyas zhes bya bas ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam rgyas zhes bya bas ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: By the term expanded, the perfection of knowledge is indicated.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub thob par bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub thob par bya ba la /
translated: In order to attain such enlightenment,üîΩeven the suffering of remaining in the hells at all times will not be an obstacle to attaining manifest enlightenment.

original: sems can dmyal ba na dus thams cad du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba la bar chad du mi 'gyur gyi bgegs @255b su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba na dus thams cad du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba la bar chad du mi 'gyur gyi bgegs @255b su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it will not be an impediment.

original: theg pa gzhan la rtog par bdag phan mchog bsil ba //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la rtog par bdag phan mchog bsil ba //
translated: The supreme coolness that benefits oneself is imagined in another vehicle.

original: bde ba'i mchog la gnas pa la yang bgegs su 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog la gnas pa la yang bgegs su 'gyur //
translated: It is an obstacle to abiding in the highest bliss.

original: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub thob par bya ba la bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub thob par bya ba la bgegs su 'gyur ba 'di yin te /
translated: Here, this is the obstacle to the bodhisattvas' attainment of enlightenment:

original: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa bdag la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa dang / bdag nyid bsil ba ste /
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pa bdag la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa dang / bdag nyid bsil ba ste /
translated: The attention of the disciples and hermit buddhas, which is concerned with one's own benefit and happiness, and which is one's own cooling,

original: bdag 'ba' zhig mya ngan las 'das par bya ba la rtog pa de ni bgegs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag 'ba' zhig mya ngan las 'das par bya ba la rtog pa de ni bgegs su 'gyur te /
translated: that is, the thought of one's own attainment of nirvana, is an obstacle.

original: gang gi bgegs su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi bgegs su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: To what is it an obstacle?

original: bde ba'i mchog la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog la gnas pa ste /
translated: To abiding in the highest bliss.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya ba la bgegs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya ba la bgegs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is an obstacle to attaining the bliss of nonabiding nirvana.

original: ngo bo med dang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la skrag pa spang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo bo med dang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la skrag pa spang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Four verses on the abandonment of fear of realitylessness and natural purity.

original: chos rnams ngo bo med pa zhes bshad pa snang zhing dmigs su rung ngo zhes bshad pa yang /
analyzed: chos rnams ngo bo med pa zhes bshad pa snang zhing dmigs su rung ngo zhes bshad pa yang /
translated: The explanation that phenomena are essenceless and the explanation that they appear and are suitable to be observed

original: byis pa rnams skrag par 'gyur ba'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: byis pa rnams skrag par 'gyur ba'i gnas yin la /
translated: are the grounds for the fear of the childish.

original: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag go zhes bshad la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag go zhes bshad la /
translated: The explanation that the basic element of phenomena is pure by nature

original: dri ma yang dag go zhes bshad pa yang byis pa rnams skrag pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: dri ma yang dag go zhes bshad pa yang byis pa rnams skrag pa'i gnas te /
translated: and the explanation that it is pure of defilements are the grounds for the fear of the childish.

original: skrag pa de spang pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bzhin rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skrag pa de spang pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bzhin rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to eliminate that fear, the verses are composed. This is the meaning.

original: yang na byis pa rnams skrag pa'i gnas ni gsum ste /üîΩchos rnams thams cad nas thams cad du med do zhes bshad na yang skrag pa'i gnas so //üîΩchos thams cad yod de dmigs su rung ngo zhes smra na yang skrag pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: yang na byis pa rnams skrag pa'i gnas ni gsum ste / chos rnams thams cad nas thams cad du med do zhes bshad na yang skrag pa'i gnas so // chos thams cad yod de dmigs su rung ngo zhes smra na yang skrag pa'i gnas so //
translated: Alternatively, there are three grounds for the fear of the childish.üîΩEven though it is explained that all phenomena are nonexistent in every respect, this is a ground for fear.üîΩEven though it is said that all phenomena exist and are observable, this is a ground for fear.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag mod kyi phyis kyang dag par bya dgos so zhes bshad pa yang skrag pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag mod kyi phyis kyang dag par bya dgos so zhes bshad pa yang skrag pa'i gnas te /
translated: Even though it is explained that all phenomena are pure by nature and must be purified later, this is a ground for fear.

original: skrag pa de spang pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bzhi rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skrag pa de spang pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bzhi rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point of the four verses is to eliminate that fear.üîΩThe non-entity of things is the objective mental support,

original: chos kyi dngos med dmigs pa dang // nyon mongs mi rtag rnam dag la //
analyzed: chos kyi dngos med dmigs pa dang // nyon mongs mi rtag rnam dag la //
translated: and the afflictions are impermanent and pure.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: chos rnams kyi dngos po med cing stong ngo zhes bya ba la snang zhing dmigs su rung ngo zhes bshad pa 'di skrag pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dngos po med cing stong ngo zhes bya ba la snang zhing dmigs su rung ngo zhes bshad pa 'di skrag pa'i gnas te /
translated: it is said that the non-entity of things, their emptiness, is apparent and can be observed. This is a basis for fear.

original: byis pa dag 'di snyam du ri bong gi rva dngos po med kyang /
analyzed: byis pa dag 'di snyam du ri bong gi rva dngos po med kyang /
translated: The childish think, ‚ÄúThe non-entity of a rabbit‚Äôs horns

original: dmigs su mi rung ba bzhin du chos rnams kyang dngos po med na ni dmigs su mi rung la /
analyzed: dmigs su mi rung ba bzhin du chos rnams kyang dngos po med na ni dmigs su mi rung la /
translated: is not observable. If things are non-entities, they cannot be observed.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa dmigs su rung ngo zhes bshad pa 'di 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos @256a * //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa dmigs su rung ngo zhes bshad pa 'di 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos @256a * //
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory to say that a non-entity can be observed.‚Äù

original: kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag la phyis kyang nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya dgos so zhes bshad pa 'di yang skrag pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag la phyis kyang nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par bya dgos so zhes bshad pa 'di yang skrag pa'i gnas te /
translated: This statement that the realm of reality is pure by nature but must be purified of afflictions later is also a basis for fear.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byis pa rnams 'di snyam du gal te chos rnams rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams 'di snyam du gal te chos rnams rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin na /
translated: Because fools think, if phenomena are pure by nature,

original: nyon mongs pa bsal ci dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bsal ci dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: what need is there to eliminate afflictions?

original: sgyu ma 'dra bar shes bya ste //
analyzed: sgyu ma 'dra bar shes bya ste //
translated: They should be known to be like illusions

original: de bzhin nam mkha' bzhin du'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin nam mkha' bzhin du'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and also like the sky.

original: chos dngos po med kyang dmigs su rung ba ni rgyu dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: chos dngos po med kyang dmigs su rung ba ni rgyu dang 'dra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, although things do not exist, they are observed, like causes.

original: dper na sgyu ma dmigs su med kyang rta dang glang po lta bur dmigs su rung ba de bzhin du chos 'di dag dngos po med kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa lta bur dmigs su rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma dmigs su med kyang rta dang glang po lta bur dmigs su rung ba de bzhin du chos 'di dag dngos po med kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa lta bur dmigs su rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, although an illusion does not exist, it is observed as a horse or an elephant. In the same way, although these phenomena do not exist, they are observed as form, sound, and so on. This is the meaning.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag kyang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag kyang /
translated: Although pure by nature,

original: phyis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' bzhin te /
analyzed: phyis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni nam mkha' bzhin te /
translated: Later, it becomes pure, like space.

original: dper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dag pa la glo bur gyi sprin gyis rnyog nas dri ma can du byas pa de sprin dang bral na dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dag pa la glo bur gyi sprin gyis rnyog nas dri ma can du byas pa de sprin dang bral na dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, space is pure by nature, but it is made impure by the adventitious defilement of clouds. When it is free of clouds, it becomes pure.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas dri ma can du byas pa de sbyang dgos pas na rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la phyis dag par 'gyur ba 'gal ba med do
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang rang bzhin gyis dag pa yin pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas dri ma can du byas pa de sbyang dgos pas na rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la phyis dag par 'gyur ba 'gal ba med do
translated: Likewise, the dharmadhatu is pure by nature, but it is made impure by the adventitious defilements of desire and so on. Since it must be purified, there is no contradiction in saying that it is pure by nature and that it becomes pure later.

original: // chos kyi dngos po med kyang dmigs su rung ba'i ri mo'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // chos kyi dngos po med kyang dmigs su rung ba'i ri mo'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To illustrate the fact that although the entities of phenomena do not exist, they can be perceived, it is said:

original: ji ltar ri mo cho ga bzhin bris pa //
analyzed: ji ltar ri mo cho ga bzhin bris pa //
translated: Just as a picture drawn according to rule

original: mthon dman med de 'on kyang snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mthon dman med de 'on kyang snang bar 'gyur //
translated: is not high or low, yet appears to be,

original: de bzhin yang dag ma yin kun rtog kyang //üîΩmdor na gnyis po med de snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin yang dag ma yin kun rtog kyang // mdor na gnyis po med de snang bar 'gyur //
translated: so, although the imagination of what is unrealüîΩis not dual, it appears as such.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In brief, the two do not exist, yet they appear.

original: dper na ras la ri mo mkhan gyis sa tshon rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gzugs rnam pa mang po cho ga bzhin du bris pa la /
analyzed: dper na ras la ri mo mkhan gyis sa tshon rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gzugs rnam pa mang po cho ga bzhin du bris pa la /
translated: For example, a painter draws various forms with various colors on a cloth.

original: lag pas byugs na mthon dman dang 'bar 'bur med kyang mig gis bltas na mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa mthon dman dang 'bar 'bur du snang ba de dang 'dra ba yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog kyang ste /
analyzed: lag pas byugs na mthon dman dang 'bar 'bur med kyang mig gis bltas na mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa mthon dman dang 'bar 'bur du snang ba de dang 'dra ba yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog kyang ste /
translated: If one touches it with one's hand, there is no high or low, no relief, but if one looks at it with one's eyes, one sees high and low, relief, such as head, hands, and feet.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ste /
translated: In the same way, the imagination of what is unreal, although the relative identity has no duality of subject and object, appears as if it had a duality of subject and object.

original: de bas na med kyang snang ba ni ri mo'i dpe dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bas na med kyang snang ba ni ri mo'i dpe dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, the example of the painting illustrates the fact that although it does not exist, it appears.

original: de ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas sems chu'i rang bzhin dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar rnyog pa'i chu ni dang nas kyang /
analyzed: de ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas sems chu'i rang bzhin dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar rnyog pa'i chu ni dang nas kyang /
translated: This is because the third and fourth verses show that mind is like water.üîΩJust as water, when disturbed,

original: de las de ni dang bar mi 'gyur @256b ro //

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la byams pa dang bu dang 'dra bar 'dzin pa ni dpe phug ron dang 'dra ste dpe phug ron bya gzhan pas lhag par 'dod chags che bas bu la byams te /

original: nam sgong nga byung ba'i dus na brtsams nas sgo gshog ma rdzogs kyi bar du brang dang lus dang gshog pas g-yogs nas 'dug ste /üîΩde lta bu'i sems yod pa de lta bu la zhe sdang ba'am mi dran pa'i sems cung zad byung na yang de ni mi mthun zhing 'gal ba yin no zhes de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis snying rje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam sgong nga byung ba'i dus na brtsams nas sgo gshog ma rdzogs kyi bar du brang dang lus dang gshog pas g-yogs nas 'dug ste / de lta bu'i sems yod pa de lta bu la zhe sdang ba'am mi dran pa'i sems cung zad byung na yang de ni mi mthun zhing 'gal ba yin no zhes de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis snying rje dang ldan pa /
translated: From the time the eggs hatch until the chicks' wings are fully grown, the dove sits on them, covering them with its breast, body and wings.üîΩIf the slightest thought of anger or forgetfulness arises in such a mind, it is incompatible and in conflict with it.

original: byams pa'i bdag nyid can sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa'i bdag nyid can sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar dgongs pa ste /
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas, who naturally have compassion and are loving by nature, think of all sentient beings as if they were their only child.

original: gal te sems can la zhes sdang ba'i sems cung zad cig byung na de ni byams pa'i sems dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te sems can la zhes sdang ba'i sems cung zad cig byung na de ni byams pa'i sems dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gang phyir byams pa de phyir khong khro 'gal //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang phyir byams pa de phyir khong khro 'gal // zhes bya ba la /

original: zhe sdang gi sems byung na ji ltar 'gal ba ston te /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sems byung na ji ltar 'gal ba ston te /

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis sems can la byams pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa yin na sems can la khong khro ba'i sems byung na 'ga' zhig mi mthun pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgang phyir zhi bas de phyir sdug bsngal 'gal //

translated: Because the bodhisattva naturally abides in the nature of love for sentient beings, if a mind of anger toward sentient beings arises, it is contradictory.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of peace, suffering is contradictory.

analyzed: dper na tshon gyis btsos pa'i gos tshon gyis zhen par bya ba'i phyir / gzung ba dang bkru ba'i las kyis gos kyi dri ma byang bar byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la yang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las gsum byang zhing dag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, a cloth that is boiled with dye is dyed in order to be seized by the dye.

original: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa la sogs pa'i las la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa la sogs pa'i las la 'jug par byed do //
translated: Just as the action of washing cleanses the cloth of its stains, in the same way, the Bodhisattva engages in the action of not killing, not stealing, and so on, in order to purify and cleanse the three actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of morality.

original: sems can mi 'tshe rab 'jug pa'i //
analyzed: sems can mi 'tshe rab 'jug pa'i //
translated: He engages in the action of not harming sentient beings

original: ji ltar phas ni bus bzhin la'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar phas ni bus bzhin la'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: just as a father does to his son.

original: ji ltar pha de bu gzhon nu shed ma bye ba yod pas /
analyzed: ji ltar pha de bu gzhon nu shed ma bye ba yod pas /
translated: Just as a father, because of his young son's lack of strength,üîΩdoes not become angry when the son climbs on his lap and kicks him, but feels compassion;

original: bzeg  pa dang brad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas gnod pa byas kyang zhe sdang mi skye'i snying rje'i sems skye ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don byed pa na sems can nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas shed ma bye ba
analyzed: bzeg  pa dang brad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas gnod pa byas kyang zhe sdang mi skye'i snying rje'i sems skye ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don byed pa na sems can nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas shed ma bye ba
translated: in just the same way, when bodhisattvas are working for the welfare of sentient beings, sentient beings, who are under the influence of defilement and lack the strength of virtue,

original: rnams kyis gnod pa sna tshogs byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa dang zhe sdang gi sems mi skye'i snying rje ba'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: rnams kyis gnod pa sna tshogs byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa dang zhe sdang gi sems mi skye'i snying rje ba'i sems skye ste /
translated: do all kinds of harm to the bodhisattvas, but the bodhisattvas do not feel anger or hatred, but feel compassion.

original: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of patience.

original: rgyun bcad rab tu 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: rgyun bcad rab tu 'jug pa ni //
translated: The uninterrupted engagement

original: me 'dod gtsub gtan gtsub shing la'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me 'dod gtsub gtan gtsub shing la'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is like the rubbing stick for the fire stick of one who wants fire.

original: dper na me 'dod pa'i mi me'i don du gtsub gtan la gtsub shing me ma phyin gyi bar du ngal ba med par gtsubs par byed do //
analyzed: dper na me 'dod pa'i mi me'i don du gtsub gtan la gtsub shing me ma phyin gyi bar du ngal ba med par gtsubs par byed do //
translated: For example, a person who wants fire rubs a rubbing stick for the fire stick until fire appears, without resting.

original: de dang 'dra @260a * //
analyzed: de dang 'dra @260a * //
translated: In the same way,

original: bar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba la bsgom pa mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bar byang chub sems dpa' dge ba la bsgom pa mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In the middle, the bodhisattva perfects the meditation on virtue.üîΩ

original: ngal ba med par dge ba la rgyun du 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngal ba med par dge ba la rgyun du 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: In the middle, the bodhisattva is without weariness in constantly engaging in virtue in order to perfect the cultivation of virtue.

original: 'dis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: By this, he demonstrates the perfection of effort.üîΩThe perfection of meditation is shown in the verse

original: lhag pa'i sems la rab 'jug pa //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la rab 'jug pa //
translated: Entering into higher thought,

original: yid gcugs rdzogs par gyur pa la'o //üîΩzhes bya pa la /
analyzed: yid gcugs rdzogs par gyur pa la'o // zhes bya pa la /
translated: in the completion of confidence.

original: de la dkor dang bang mdzod la sogs pa'i dbang dang spyod du bcug kyang /
analyzed: de la dkor dang bang mdzod la sogs pa'i dbang dang spyod du bcug kyang /
translated: There, even though one is allowed to enjoy the king's treasury and granary,

original: rnam pa gang gis kyang srid pa mi skye zhing bdag gir mi byed pa de ni yid gcugs pa la rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kyang srid pa mi skye zhing bdag gir mi byed pa de ni yid gcugs pa la rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: by no means does one generate craving or make it one's own. That is called the completion of confidence.

original: de la yid gcugs rdzogs pa de rgyal po'i bang mdzod dang dkor la dbang yod kyang cung zad tsam yang sred pa dang chags ba mi skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la yid gcugs rdzogs pa de rgyal po'i bang mdzod dang dkor la dbang yod kyang cung zad tsam yang sred pa dang chags ba mi skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: There, even though one has completed confidence and has control over the king's treasury and granary, one does not generate even the slightest craving or attachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dbang yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dbang yod de /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva has control over the perfection of meditation.

original: bsam gtan thob kyang bsam gtan gyi ro'i bde ba la cung zad tsam yang chags pa mi skyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan thob kyang bsam gtan gyi ro'i bde ba la cung zad tsam yang chags pa mi skyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though he has attained the meditative concentrations, he does not generate the slightest attachment to the pleasure of the taste of the meditative concentrations.

original: yang na yid gcugs pa'i mi de la /
analyzed: yang na yid gcugs pa'i mi de la /
translated: Or else, he is like a person who is trusted,

original: phyi nang gi gtam kun yang ma lus par smra zhing ji ltar gyur kyang yid gcugs pa'i mi de bar ma dor mi gtong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: phyi nang gi gtam kun yang ma lus par smra zhing ji ltar gyur kyang yid gcugs pa'i mi de bar ma dor mi gtong ba de bzhin du /
translated: who tells all his secrets, and who does not abandon that trusted person even in the slightest.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang bsam gtan gyi spyod pa na zhugs pa nam bsam gtan gyis mthar ma phyin cing 'bras bu ma thob kyi bar du bar ma dor mi gtong zhing 'jigs par mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang bsam gtan gyi spyod pa na zhugs pa nam bsam gtan gyis mthar ma phyin cing 'bras bu ma thob kyi bar du bar ma dor mi gtong zhing 'jigs par mi byed de /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva who has entered the practice of the meditative concentrations does not abandon or fear the meditative concentrations until he has reached the end of the meditative concentrations and attained their result.

original: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //üîΩshes rab la ni rab 'jug pa //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to // shes rab la ni rab 'jug pa //
translated: This shows the perfection of meditative concentration.üîΩHe should enter into wisdom

original: sgyu ma byed bzhin shes par bya'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgyu ma byed bzhin shes par bya'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: like a magician.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan sgyu ma'i cho ga dang thabs shes pa des gdod sgyu ma byed pa'i sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po byas nas kyang 'di ni sgyu ma yin gyi rta dang glang po yang dag pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa de bzhin du
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan sgyu ma'i cho ga dang thabs shes pa des gdod sgyu ma byed pa'i sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po byas nas kyang 'di ni sgyu ma yin gyi rta dang glang po yang dag pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa de bzhin du
translated: For example, a magician, who knows the ritual and the means of illusion, having first created the illusory horse and elephant, thinks, ‚ÄúThis is an illusion, not a real horse or elephant.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrubs nas /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, having practiced the perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur phyin ci ma log par shes par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur phyin ci ma log par shes par byed de /
translated: makes all phenomena known without error as illusion-like by means of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang la ji ltar sgrub pa de //
analyzed: gang la ji ltar sgrub pa de //
translated: That which is practiced and how it is practiced

original: de ni byang chub sems dpar dgongs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpar dgongs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is considered the bodhisattva.

original: gong du bstan pa'i don bsdus nas bstan te gong ma rnams kyi don mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis shig ston te /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i don bsdus nas bstan te gong ma rnams kyi don mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis shig ston te /
translated: Here, the meaning of the above is summarized and taught. The meaning of the above is summarized and two things are taught:

analyzed: gang la sgrub cing 'jug pa dang / ji ltar sgrub cing 'jug pa ste /
translated: that which is practiced and engaged in, and how it is practiced and engaged in.

analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is considered to be the one who practices.

original: de la gang la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de la gang la 'jug ce na /
translated: What does he enter?

analyzed: @260b nad pa sman la 'jug pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la 'khor bar 'jug go //
translated: The bodhisattva enters samsara for the sake of sentient beings, just as a doctor enters a patient's house.

original: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ce na /

original: sems can la ni rab 'jug pa //üîΩzhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sems can la ni rab 'jug pa // zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: He enters into sentient beings.

original: ji ltar 'jug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug par bya zhe na /

analyzed: de yang 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang skyon ji lta bu yin pa so sor brtags te shes par bya ba nas 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos par bya ste 'jug go //
translated: One should engage in the three realms for the sake of sentient beings, having examined the faults and problems of cyclic existence.

translated: One should engage in the three realms for the sake of sentient

original: 'khor bar 'jug pas ni gang la bslab par bya ba bstan /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug pas ni gang la bslab par bya ba bstan /
translated: By the entry into cyclic existence, he shows what is to be learned.

original: sman pa la sogs pa man chad kyis ji ltar bslab par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: sman pa la sogs pa man chad kyis ji ltar bslab par bya ba bstan to //
translated: By the rest of the examples, beginning with the physician, he shows how one should learn.

original: snying rje bas sems can nad pa la sogs pa mi gtong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje bas sems can nad pa la sogs pa mi gtong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of compassion, he does not abandon sentient beings who are sick, etc.

original: sman pa'i dpes ni snying rje dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa'i nad skyis btab pa'i sems can rnams mi gtong bar bstan to //üîΩrang gi sems rab tu legs par bcos pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sman pa'i dpes ni snying rje dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa'i nad skyis btab pa'i sems can rnams mi gtong bar bstan to // rang gi sems rab tu legs par bcos pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the example of the physician, he shows that the compassionate one does not abandon sentient beings who are afflicted by the sickness of the defilements.üîΩBy the example of the servant who is not yet trained, he shows that he trains his own mind well,

original: ma smin pa'i bran gyi dpes ni bdag gi sems ma dul ba dang / ma zhi ba legs par 'chos par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma smin pa'i bran gyi dpes ni bdag gi sems ma dul ba dang / ma zhi ba legs par 'chos par byed pa bstan to //
translated: and by the example of the servant who is already trained, he shows that he trains the minds of others well.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar go rims bzhin du longs spyod 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar go rims bzhin du longs spyod 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The six perfections are to be accomplished in order, because they increase the enjoyment of goods, etc.

original: 'di man chad ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rim bzhin du ston te /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa rim bzhin du ston te /
translated: From here on, he shows the accomplishment of the six perfections in order.

original: tshong ba'i dpes ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshong ba'i dpes ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The example of the merchant illustrates the practice of the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pas longs spyod bsgrubs nas longs spyod sems can la gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas longs spyod bsgrubs nas longs spyod sems can la gtong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, having obtained wealth through generosity, he gives it to sentient beings.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las sbyangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las sbyangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the purification of the karma of body, etc.

original: tshon mkhan gyi dpes ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshon mkhan gyi dpes ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: The example of the dyer illustrates the perfection of morality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩlus dang ngag dang yid gsum @261a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / lus dang ngag dang yid gsum @261a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: gyi las yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi las yongs su dag par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the complete purification of the karma of body, speech, and mind.

original: sems kyi gnod pa bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi gnod pa bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the patience of mental suffering.

original: pha dang bu'i dpes bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: pha dang bu'i dpes bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
translated: The example of the father and son illustrates the perfection of patience.

original: sems can gyis gnod pa byas kyang bzod de slar gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyis gnod pa byas kyang bzod de slar gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, even though sentient beings do harm, one is patient and does not do harm in return.

original: dge ba bsgom pa la rgyun tu brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba bsgom pa la rgyun tu brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should always strive to cultivate virtue.

original: gtsub shing gi dpes ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: gtsub shing gi dpes ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: The example of the fire drill shows the perfection of effort.

original: dge ba bsgom pa la rgyun mi 'chad par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba bsgom pa la rgyun mi 'chad par brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is indefatigable in the practice of virtue.üîΩBecause one is not attached to meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la mi chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la yid gcugs pa'i dpes ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mi chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la yid gcugs pa'i dpes ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
translated: The example of the friend shows the perfection of meditation.

original: bsam gtan gyi dbang thob kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba la ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dbang thob kyang bsam gtan gyi bde ba la ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is not attached to the bliss of meditation, even though one has attained mastery of meditation.

original: shes bya la phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes bya la phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no error regarding the knowable.

original: sgyu ma'i dpes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
translated: The example of the illusion shows the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes bya thams cad sgyu ma lta bu phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad sgyu ma lta bu phyin ci ma log par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all knowable things are known without error as being like an illusion.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the purity of the three spheres.

original: sgrub pa rnams kyang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul du bsgrub dgos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa rnams kyang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul du bsgrub dgos te /
translated: The perfections should be practiced in such a way that the three spheres are completely pure.

original: de bas na 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs bcad gcig brtsams so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa bstan pa'i phyir tshigs bcad gcig brtsams so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the complete purity of the three spheres, one verse is composed.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus rtag par rgya chen ldan //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus rtag par rgya chen ldan //
translated: Thus, always endowed with vast effort,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: thus means as previously explained.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Effort is twofold:

original: rtag pa'i brtson 'grus dang rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i brtson 'grus dang rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: constant effort and vast effort.

original: de la rtag pa'i brtson 'grus ni gang dge ba rgyun du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i brtson 'grus ni gang dge ba rgyun du byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, constant effort is that which is virtuous and continuous.

original: rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus ni gang theg pa chen po dang ldan pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus ni gang theg pa chen po dang ldan pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Vast effort is that which is endowed with the Great Vehicle and the effort to accomplish the perfections.

original: gnyis po yongs smin sbyangs la grub //
analyzed: gnyis po yongs smin sbyangs la grub //
translated: The two are accomplished in complete ripening and purification.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de ltar rtag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus gnyis kyis gnyis po yongs su smin pa dang / sbyang bar bya ba la 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus gnyis kyis gnyis po yongs su smin pa dang / sbyang bar bya ba la 'grub ste /
translated: thus, the two, constant effort and vast effort, are accomplished in the two, complete ripening and purification.

original: gnyis po ni bsod nams kyi tshogs sam /
analyzed: gnyis po ni bsod nams kyi tshogs sam /
translated: The first two are the accumulation of merit.üîΩ

original: ye shes kyi tshogs sam bdag gi don tam gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs sam bdag gi don tam gzhan gyi don te /
translated: The first two are the stores of merit and of intuition, or else they are for one's own and others' benefit.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis ni bdag gi don yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis ni bdag gi don yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: The store of merit ripens one's own benefit,

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni bdag dang gzhan yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ni bdag dang gzhan yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: and the store of intuition purifies one's own and others' benefit.

original: mi rtog dri med blo mchog gis //
analyzed: mi rtog dri med blo mchog gis //
translated: By the supreme, stainless, non-conceptual intuition,

original: 'grub dang mchog ni rim gyis des thob 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'grub dang mchog ni rim gyis des thob 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one gradually attains the accomplishments and the highest.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag @261b med par khong du chud pa'i ye shes la mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag @261b med par khong du chud pa'i ye shes la mi rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the intuition which is the realization of the selflessness of persons and of phenomena is called the non-conceptual intuition.

original: ji la mi rtog ce na /
analyzed: ji la mi rtog ce na /
translated: What is it non-conceptual with respect to?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i sems can dang / sgrub pa'i chos gsum yod par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i sems can dang / sgrub pa'i chos gsum yod par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is non-conceptual with respect to the three: the bodhisattva who is the practitioner, the sentient beings who are the objects of practice, and the practice itself.

original: ye shes de la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma med pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes de la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma med pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That intuition is called stainless because it is free from the stains of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the three spheres are totally pure.

original: de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la blo mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la blo mchog ces bya ste /
translated: Thus, the highest mind is the nonconceptual wisdom that is totally pure of the three spheres.

original: ye shes des sgrub par byed pa dang / bsgrub bar bya ba dang / sgrub pa gsum la mi rtog pa'i tshul du bsgrubs nas sa bcu rim gyis mnan nas sangs rgyas kyi sar byang chub sems dpa' des sgrub pa mchog thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes des sgrub par byed pa dang / bsgrub bar bya ba dang / sgrub pa gsum la mi rtog pa'i tshul du bsgrubs nas sa bcu rim gyis mnan nas sangs rgyas kyi sar byang chub sems dpa' des sgrub pa mchog thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Having practiced with that wisdom in a nonconceptual way, the three‚Äîthe practice, the one who practices, and the object of practice‚Äîthat bodhisattva gradually conquers the ten grounds and attains the highest practice on the ground of buddhahood.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he will attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The section explaining practice is finished.

original: // / gdams shing bstan par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcu rtsa gcig ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / gdams shing bstan par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga bcu rtsa gcig ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fifty-one verses that are to be taught and explained.

original: sgrub pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu gdams shing bstan par bya ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu gdams shing bstan par bya ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on practice and the section that is to be taught and explained?

original: 'dir bslab pa'i rnam par bshad pa'i skabs yin te /üîΩbslab pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par yang bsam pa'i khyad par dang / bdag la phan pa'i khyad par dang / gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par dang / mthar phyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la chos la mos pa mang ba'i skabs su bsam pa'i khyad par bstan /üîΩchos 'tshol ba'i skabs su sbyor ba'i khyad par bstan /
analyzed: 'dir bslab pa'i rnam par bshad pa'i skabs yin te / bslab pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par yang bsam pa'i khyad par dang / bdag la phan pa'i khyad par dang / gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par dang / mthar phyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par la chos la mos pa mang ba'i skabs su bsam pa'i khyad par bstan / chos 'tshol ba'i skabs su sbyor ba'i khyad par bstan /
translated: This is the section that explains the aspects of the training.

original: sgrub pa'i skabs su bdag la phan pa'i khyad par bstan /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i skabs su bdag la phan pa'i khyad par bstan /
translated: The specific features of the aspects of the training are taught in the section on the many kinds of interest in the teachings, which is the specific feature of attitude; in the section on seeking the teachings, which is the specific feature of application; in the section on practice, which is the specific feature of benefiting oneself; and in the section on explaining the teachings, which is the specific feature of benefiting others.

original: chos 'chad pa'i skabs su gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par bstan nas da ni mthar thug pa'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i skabs su gzhan la phan pa'i khyad par bstan nas da ni mthar thug pa'i khyad par ston te /
translated: The present section is the one on the specific feature of the ultimate.

original: de'ang sgrub pa dang ldan ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis rnam par dag cing mthar thug par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis kyang gdams pa dang bstan par brtsal bar bya la /
analyzed: de'ang sgrub pa dang ldan ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis rnam par dag cing mthar thug par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis kyang gdams pa dang bstan par brtsal bar bya la /
translated: In order to purify and perfect the two paths of seeing and meditation, bodhisattvas who are practicing should themselves seek instructions and teachings.

original: gzhan yang gdams pa dang bstan pa la bzhag dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gdams pa dang bstan pa la bzhag dgos te /
translated: Moreover, one must be placed in the instructions and teachings.

original: de bas na sgrub pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu gdams pa dang bstan pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na sgrub pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu gdams pa dang bstan pa'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, after the section on practice, the section on instructions and teachings is explained, which is connected.

original: bskal pa grangs med 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med 'byung ba ni //
translated: The arising of three incalculable eons

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is stated.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum la mos pa spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i @262a * //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum la mos pa spyod pa'i sar bskal pa grangs med pa gcig du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i @262a * //
translated: In three incalculable eons, in the stage of devoted conduct, one incalculable eon is devoted to the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: spyad pas sa dang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyad pas sa dang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that the first stage arises through the practice of bodhisattva conduct.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad ce na /
translated: How does one practice the conduct of a bodhisattva?üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / chos spyod rnam par 'phel byed cing //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos spyod rnam par 'phel byed cing //
translated: increasing the practice of Dharma,

original: dge ba'i chos ni rab rdzogs pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni rab rdzogs pa //
translated: perfectly completing virtuous qualities,

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin no //
translated: like the water of the ocean.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is stated.

original: mos pa dang dad pa zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
analyzed: mos pa dang dad pa zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
translated: Devotion and faith have the same meaning.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sar mos pa dang / dad pa shas je che je cher byas nas 'jig rten gyi chos mchog tu dad pa shas cher byas pa la mos spyod rnam par 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sar mos pa dang / dad pa shas je che je cher byas nas 'jig rten gyi chos mchog tu dad pa shas cher byas pa la mos spyod rnam par 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: On the level of earnest aspiration, one's interest and faith increase more and more and one's interest in the supreme mundane level increases more and more. This is called the development of interest and practice.

original: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa gong ma gong ma thob par byas pa ni mos spyod 'phel bar byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mos pa spyod pa'i sa gong ma gong ma thob par byas pa ni mos spyod 'phel bar byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the development of interest and practice is the attainment of higher and higher levels of earnest aspiration.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa drod kyi dus na ni ming sgyu ma lta bur rtogs /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa drod kyi dus na ni ming sgyu ma lta bur rtogs /
translated: On the level of earnest aspiration, at the time of warmth, one realizes that names are like an illusion;

original: rtse mo'i dus na ni don sgyu ma lta bur rtogs /
analyzed: rtse mo'i dus na ni don sgyu ma lta bur rtogs /
translated: at the time of the peak, one realizes that objects are like an illusion;

original: bzod pa'i dus na ni gzung ba mi dmigs par rtogs /
analyzed: bzod pa'i dus na ni gzung ba mi dmigs par rtogs /
translated: at the time of acceptance, one realizes that the apprehended object has no reality;

original: 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na ni 'dzin pa yang mi dmigs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi dus na ni 'dzin pa yang mi dmigs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: and at the time of the supreme mundane level, one realizes that the apprehending subject has no reality either.

original: de ltar mos pa 'phel bar 'gyur bas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mos pa 'phel bar 'gyur bas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, as one's interest develops, one completes the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de'ang dper na rgya mtsho chus gang zhing rgyas pa dang 'dra bar de'i sems la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ji tsam gyis sa dang po khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs shing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'ang dper na rgya mtsho chus gang zhing rgyas pa dang 'dra bar de'i sems la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ji tsam gyis sa dang po khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs shing rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the ocean is filled and expanded by water, so also his mind is filled and expanded by the collections of merit and pristine wisdom, to the extent that he will penetrate the first spiritual level.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sdu na nas dag pa'i rgyal ba'i sras //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdu na nas dag pa'i rgyal ba'i sras // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sons of the Victor, who have entered the stages,üîΩare pure in their intent, and have increased their interest.

original: de ltar bskal pa grangs med par zhugs pa dang / mos pa 'phel ba dang / chos rdzogs pa ni sdu na nas dag pa'i rgyal ba'i sras zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa grangs med par zhugs pa dang / mos pa 'phel ba dang / chos rdzogs pa ni sdu na nas dag pa'i rgyal ba'i sras zhes bya ste /
translated: The sons of the Victor, who have entered the incalculable eons, who have increased their interest, and who have completed the Dharma, are pure in their intent.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sar byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum char dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sar byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum char dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that on the spiritual level of action out of faith, the bodhisattvas are pure in all three of the moral disciplines.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The three moral disciplines are the moral discipline of restraint, the moral discipline of acquiring virtue, and the moral discipline of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de ltar tshogs ni bsags pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar tshogs ni bsags pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the accumulations are gathered.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas theg pa chen po'i chos phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing sems la 'dzin pas na theg pa chen po lta ba drang ba ste /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pas theg pa chen po'i chos phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing sems la 'dzin pas na theg pa chen po lta ba drang ba ste /
translated: As explained above, by gathering the accumulations of merit and wisdom, one realizes the Mahayana teachings without error and holds them in the mind, so it is called the straight view of the Mahayana.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lta bar ma ltung ba ni /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lta bar ma ltung ba ni /
translated: Not falling into the views of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on is

original: chogs bsags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chogs bsags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: called gathering the accumulations.

original: rab shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: Well-known.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sar theg pa chen pa'i chos mang du thos pa la rab tu shes pa zhes @262b bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sar theg pa chen pa'i chos mang du thos pa la rab tu shes pa zhes @262b bya'o //
translated: On the level of practice through belief, listening to many Mahayana teachings is called being well-known.

original: sems ni dge ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems ni dge ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is virtuous.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i dus nas dang po thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas na /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa'i dus nas dang po thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas na /
translated: From the time of the level of practice through belief, by abandoning the obscurations that interrupt the attainment of the first [level],

original: sems dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called a virtuous mind.

original: de ltar bsgom pa rnam par dag par byas pa dang / lta ba drang por byas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / sgrib pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i 'og tu 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du bsgom par byas pas na /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa rnam par dag par byas pa dang / lta ba drang por byas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / sgrib pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i 'og tu 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du bsgom par byas pas na /
translated: Having thus purified the meditation, and having straightened out the view, and having listened to many teachings, and having abandoned the obscurations, and so on, one should meditate in the manner that will be explained below.

original: bsgom pa la ni brtson pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa la ni brtson pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, one should strive in meditation.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul ni de nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul ni de nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The manner that will be explained below is Then, with regard to the Dharma of the sutras and so on.

original: chos kyi rgyun las sangs rgyas las //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyun las sangs rgyas las //
translated: From the stream of Dharma, from the Buddha,üîΩBecause of the expansion of serenity

original: zhi gnas rnam par rgyas pa dang // ye shes rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: zhi gnas rnam par rgyas pa dang // ye shes rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: and the expansion of wisdom,

original: de tshe lung bstan thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de tshe lung bstan thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: at that time one obtains the prophecy.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar mos pa spyod pa'i sar mos pa dang dad pa 'phel ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / sdom pa rnam par dag pa dang / theg pa chen po la lta ba drang ba dang /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar mos pa spyod pa'i sar mos pa dang dad pa 'phel ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / sdom pa rnam par dag pa dang / theg pa chen po la lta ba drang ba dang /
translated: As explained above, on the level of devoted engagement, one increases devotion and faith, accumulates the collections of merit and wisdom, purifies one's vows, and straightens out one's view of the Great Vehicle.

original: thos pa mang ba dang / sgrib pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa mang ba dang / sgrib pa spangs pa ste /
translated: 1. much listening, and 2. elimination of obscurations.

original: lus dang sems las su rung bar byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas sangs rgyas rnams las sa dang po thob bar bya ba'i don du bstan pa dang gdams pa'i lung thob bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung bar byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas sangs rgyas rnams las sa dang po thob bar bya ba'i don du bstan pa dang gdams pa'i lung thob bar 'gyur te /
translated: The Bodhisattva who has made his body and mind serviceable, and who is established in the samadhi of the stream of Dharma, receives the transmission of the teaching and the precepts from the Buddhas for the purpose of attaining the first stage.

original: lung de yang zhi gnas rnam par rgyas par bya ba dang / lhag mthong rnam par rgyas par bya ba'i phyir lung nod par byed de /
analyzed: lung de yang zhi gnas rnam par rgyas par bya ba dang / lhag mthong rnam par rgyas par bya ba'i phyir lung nod par byed de /
translated: And that transmission is received in order to expand tranquility and to expand insight.

original: ye shes kyi sgras ni lhag mthong la bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgras ni lhag mthong la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúwisdom‚Äù refers to insight.

original: sa dang po thob par 'gyur ba'i lam 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi ting nge 'dzin la chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob par 'gyur ba'i lam 'jig rten gyi chos mchog gi ting nge 'dzin la chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The samadhi of the stream of Dharma is called the samadhi of the supreme mundane dharma, which is the path for attaining the first stage.

original: de nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, the Dharma called sutra, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa las bstan pa dang / gdams pa las thob nas de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa las bstan pa dang / gdams pa las thob nas de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then means having obtained the teaching and instruction from the Tathagata, after that, is the meaning.

original: mdo la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa'i chos zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Dharma of the sutras, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo'i sde dang lung du bstan pa la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo'i sde dang lung du bstan pa la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis la bya'o //
translated: Etc. refers to the twelve branches of scripture, such as the sutra collection, the collection of sayings, etc.

original: gsung rab de dag kyang ji 'dra ba zhig ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / mi gnyis don dag gsal byed pa //
analyzed: gsung rab de dag kyang ji 'dra ba zhig ce na / de'i phyir / mi gnyis don dag gsal byed pa //
translated: What are those scriptures like?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: one should think, These phenomena are not suitable to be established by the three valid cognitions of direct perception, inference, and scriptural testimony.

original: ci'i phyir na gzugs la bcu gcig gzhag la bcu gnyis @264b la sogs par mang du yang ma bzhag bcu la sogs pa nyung du yang ma bzhag ces rtog pa ni dpyod pa dang rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na gzugs la bcu gcig gzhag la bcu gnyis @264b la sogs par mang du yang ma bzhag bcu la sogs pa nyung du yang ma bzhag ces rtog pa ni dpyod pa dang rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thinking, Why are forms established as eleven, and not as more than twelve, and so forth, or less than ten, and so forth? is called analysis and thinking.

original: rtag pa ni bgrang ba dang gzhal ba dang dpyad pa'i don la lta ba'o zhes bya ba la bgrang bas bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i grangs bgrangs pa dang / gzhal bas skyed skur ma byas pa dang / dpyad pas rigs par gtan la phab pa'i chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi don lta ba ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni bgrang ba dang gzhal ba dang dpyad pa'i don la lta ba'o zhes bya ba la bgrang bas bcu gnyis la sogs pa'i grangs bgrangs pa dang / gzhal bas skyed skur ma byas pa dang / dpyad pas rigs par gtan la phab pa'i chos de dag gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi don lta ba ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The counted is the enumeration of the number of twelve, etc. The measured is the uncreated. The examined is the Dharma which is established by reasoning. The view of the meaning of the general and particular characteristics of those is called perpetual.

original: yi ge la rnam pa gnyis su brtag ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge la rnam pa gnyis su brtag ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The syllable is twofold: the existent and the nonexistent.

original: yi ge la rnam pa gnyis su brtag ste /
analyzed: yi ge la rnam pa gnyis su brtag ste /
translated: The syllable is twofold:

original: don yod par brtag pa dang / don med par brtag ba'o //
analyzed: don yod par brtag pa dang / don med par brtag ba'o //
translated: the existent and the nonexistent.

original: yi ge mang po la don dang bcas pa dang / gcig pa don med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge mang po la don dang bcas pa dang / gcig pa don med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The many syllables have meaning, and the one syllable is meaningless.

original: 'dus byas mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa yi ge mang po la ni don yod par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa yi ge mang po la ni don yod par brtag par bya ste /
translated: The many syllables such as impermanent compounded phenomena, etc., are to be considered as having meaning.

original: ji ltar don yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don yod ce na /
translated: How do they have meaning?

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they teach the meaning of impermanence, etc.

original: aa dang ka la sogs pa'i yi ge gcig pa ni don med par brtag ste /
analyzed: aa dang ka la sogs pa'i yi ge gcig pa ni don med par brtag ste /
translated: The single letter, such as a or ka, is to be examined as meaningless.

original: yi ge gcig gi don gang yang mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge gcig gi don gang yang mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a single letter does not signify any meaning.

original: 'dzin pa'i sems ni gang gis ji ltar rjes su brtag pa'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i sems ni gang gis ji ltar rjes su brtag pa'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is the apprehending mind to be examined?

original: 'dzin pa'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the apprehending mind like?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang gis rjes su dpyod pa'i sems kyi skabs su mdo sde rnams tshig re re nas ji skad 'byung ba'i tshig rnams kyi mtshan ma 'dzin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang gis rjes su dpyod pa'i sems kyi skabs su mdo sde rnams tshig re re nas ji skad 'byung ba'i tshig rnams kyi mtshan ma 'dzin te /
translated: The bodhisattva, by whatever wisdom, in the context of the mind of subsequent analysis, apprehends the characteristics of the words as they appear, one by one, in the sutras.

original: ji ltar mtshan ma 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan ma 'dzin ce na /
translated: How does one apprehend the characteristics?

original: mdo sde 'di'i tshig ni 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes gtan la 'bebs pa ni 'dzin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i tshig ni 'di kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes gtan la 'bebs pa ni 'dzin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the apprehending mind because it ascertains, The words of this sutra are precisely these, nothing else.

original: rnam par brtag pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It apprehends the characteristics of the analyzed object.

original: yang rnam par brtag pa'i sems kyi skabs su don la rnam par rtog pa la /
analyzed: yang rnam par brtag pa'i sems kyi skabs su don la rnam par rtog pa la /
translated: In the context of the analyzing mind, in the analysis of the meaning,

original: grangs la sogs pa la rtog pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir bshad pa dang / yi ge la rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa la rtog pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir bshad pa dang / yi ge la rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la /
translated: The four types of conceptualization, such as that of number, etc., and the two types of conceptualization of syllables.

original: de dag gi mtshan ma 'dzin te ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan ma 'dzin te ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
translated: How does one apprehend their signs?

original: 'di dag ni 'di kho na lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'di kho na lta bu yin gyi /
translated: These are just like this,üîΩnot otherwise.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes gtan la 'bebs pa ni 'dzin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes gtan la 'bebs pa ni 'dzin pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that determines is called the apprehending mind.

original: bsdu ba'i sems ni gang gis ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i don rtsa ba'i sems su bsdus nas bsdu pa'i tshul du 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i sems ni gang gis ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'i don rtsa ba'i sems su bsdus nas bsdu pa'i tshul du 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind of collection is that by which, having collected the meaning that was investigated into the root mind, one engages in the mode of collection.

original: bsdu pa'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsdu pa'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of collection like?

original: @265a * // byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang gis gong du rnam par brtags pa'i chos don la rnam par brtag pa la yang /
analyzed: @265a * // byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab gang gis gong du rnam par brtags pa'i chos don la rnam par brtag pa la yang /
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva by which one investigates the meaning that was previously investigated in the Dharma.

original: bgrang ba dang gzhal ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir brtag pa dang / yi ge la yang don yod pa dang / med pa rnam pa gnyis su brtags pa de dag la bsdu ba'i tshul du 'jug ste /
analyzed: bgrang ba dang gzhal ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir brtag pa dang / yi ge la yang don yod pa dang / med pa rnam pa gnyis su brtags pa de dag la bsdu ba'i tshul du 'jug ste /
translated: The four investigations of enumeration, evaluation, examination and discernment and the two investigations of the existence or nonexistence of meaning in syllables are engaged as a method of synthesis.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ji snyed du mdo sde yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: ji snyed du mdo sde yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa de dag kyang /
translated: All the explanations of the twelve branches of scripture are included in the sutra collection.

original: mdo sde'i nang du 'dus par zad do zhes rtsa ba'i sems su sdud pa'am /
analyzed: mdo sde'i nang du 'dus par zad do zhes rtsa ba'i sems su sdud pa'am /
translated: This is the synthesis of the root mind.

original: mdo sde 'di'i nang nas tshig dang yi ge mang po 'byung ba thams cad kyang nad bsdus na /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i nang nas tshig dang yi ge mang po 'byung ba thams cad kyang nad bsdus na /
translated: Or, all the many words and syllables that occur in this sutra are included in this or that subject matter.

original: 'di tsam zhig ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i sems sdud pa la bsdu ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i sems sdud pa la bsdu ba'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the synthesis of the mind.

original: re ba'i sems ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re ba'i sems ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phyir ram zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind of aspiration is for the sake of concentration.

original: re ba'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: re ba'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the mind of aspiration?

original: bdag nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs kyang rung /
translated: It is the mind that engages in the attainment of concentration by oneself.
